characters: INT/EXT. EXECUTIVE HELICOPTER, PAPUA NEW GUINEA

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. EXECUTIVE HELICOPTER, PAPUA NEW GUINEA
dialogues.text: An out of focus light reflects the deep blue sparkle of t ocean. The scene has a washed out, bright feel, as if fro distant memory. TIGHT on the face of JOSH MCGUIRE (17). He’s gazing throu the copilot window of an AUGUSTA EXECUTIVE HELICOPTER. He’s tall, slightly built and slovenly dressed in skater- gear. He has a wisp of a goatee beard and Optic Nerve sha He looks fidgety, apprehensive. His voice carries the tra of an Australian accent.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: I took off. So what? I can do what I want. I’m not a kid anymore. It ain’t all about you. Suddenly, the scene comes sharply into focus, snapping in bright color as the ROAR of the engines grows louder. The DELVENET.COM HELICOPTER banks sharply as it clears th coastline of Papua New Guinea. Lush rainforest as far as the eye can see. In the distanc range of mist-covered mountains. No sign of civilization. edge of the last great wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (AMERICAN ACCENT)
dialogues.text: They're calling it what? Flying the chopper is self-made billionaire CARL HURLEY (30's). Faded jeans and a t-shirt with ‘MY OTHER HELICOPT IS A JET’ printed across the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Hurley’s Hole”. Josh smirks at this. He turns around to see VICTORIA ALLA (30's) sitting in the rear passenger seat, reading the WA STREET JOURNAL. She looks tired and jet-lagged in her crumpled business suit, but still manages to retain a natural, understated beauty.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (READING)
dialogues.text: “Carl Hurley’s latest ‘ego tour’, to dive the ‘Mount Everest’ of underwater caves in Papua New Guinea, has already cost over three million dollars and leaves many shareholders questioning his loyalties...

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: They can all go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (READING)
dialogues.text: “The thirty-six year old CEO of Delvenet...”

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Jeez, that’s old, man.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Shut it.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (READING)
dialogues.text: “,..whose previous stunts include scaling Everest, diving Brittanic and base jumping the Eiffel Tower, is furious at the lack of media coverage his latest expedition... yada yada yada. There’s a cartoon as well...

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: Take over. Keep the horizon above the dash, like I told you. Josh flashes a quick look at Victoria, lowering his shade he grabs the CYCLIC STICK. He’s obviously trying to impre her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (NERVOUS)
dialogues.text: Carl!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Give me that piece of crap. Victoria shakes her head wearily and tightens her seat be Carl snatches the newspaper and gazes down at the headlin DELVING INTO DEBT. A caricature of Carl, wearing SCUBA EQUIPMENT as he studies a FINANCIAL FLOW CHART hung outsi cave. Another DIVER informs him “That ain’t your dive profile: it’s your share value”. Josh glances at the cartoon and shares a smile with Victo The chopper wobbles slightly. Josh blushes as he snaps hi attention back to flying.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: This expedition’s been a cluster fuck from start to finish. No disrespect, Josh, but your father’s full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (AWKWARD LAUGH)
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SARCASTIC)
dialogues.text: The world’s greatest cave diver. All he can find down there are dead- ends. No wonder we lost press coverage

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You're insane. Frustrated astronauts, all of you. Carl gazes down at the rainforest.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There could be miles of unexplored passage down there. Just waiting to be discovered.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. You'd better discover it quick. Here’s your schedule for next week. She hands him a sheet of paper covered in colored bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Carl RIPS up the schedule in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Shit! shit! shit! A long and uncomfortable silence. Victoria leans forward toward Josh, a smirk on her face.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (DRAMATIC VOICE)
dialogues.text: Looks like ‘Hurley’s Hole’ may remain forever...unprobed. Josh cracks up LAUGHING. VRRRROOM! The helicopter LURCHES VIOLENTLY as Carl grabs CONTROL STICK and flings them 500ft down a steep sided valley. Victoria SCREAMS as Carl expertly puts the helico through a 360’ BARREL-ROLL. Josh clings on for dear life the valley walls flash by. Carl levels off, thirty feet above a huge river, the engi WHINING in protest. Carl is LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (FURIOUS)
dialogues.text: You reckless son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: That was sweet! Do it again.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RIVER VALLEY
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS as the helicopter winds its way down the valley, following the surging river. Victoria tries to en the recalcitrant Josh in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: How’d you wind up here, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Court makes me see my Dad twice a year.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Bit like boot camp.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What's Frank like? I’ve heard conflicting reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: “Conflicting” pretty much sums him up. (beat) Alright, folks. We're here... Suddenly, the ground falls away. The helicopter drops ove the edge of a waterfall that cascades 1000ft into a DOLIN vast circular hole in the valley floor. A beautiful rainb hangs above the waterfall. The helicopter powers forward toward BASECAMP: a cluster PORTACABINS and large MACHINERY perched at the far side o the cliff. Josh suddenly looks sad. He stares down at the base of th waterfall, where the river disappears through a gaping vertical crack in the rock.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: I can feel your hatred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the cliff, a thick COMMUNICATION CABLE w its way into the darkness, following the river. BATS and SWALLOWS flit and dart in the dark zone.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: ..-Taste it... Every hundred feet or so, a HIGH INTENSITY DISCHARGE (HID LIGHT has been clipped to the wall, illuminating the tunn

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: -.-Breathe it... INT. SANTO CAVE SYSTEM. HIGH SPEED as we follow the cable through miles of cave, slowing occasionally at key points. The cable leads us through tight tunnels, air-filled chambers, surging river and over powerful waterfalls, rigged with rope bridges.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: ...through miles of rock... Finally, at the end of the tunnel, a dance of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river spills out into a vast chamber, three quarters filled with water. An island rises above the water, illuminated by powerful HID LIGHTS. Forward base looks li an explosion in a dive store: SCUBA EQUIPMENT is littered everywhere: WETSUITS hanging on a line, REBREATHERS and D PROPULSION VEHICLES. In the center of the island sits a large TENT. The glow f several COMPUTER MONITORS can be seen through the fabric. FIBER-OPTIC cable leads from the tent toward a DIVE PLATF that extends into the water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: ...I hope you never come out. Australian cave diver FRANK MCGUIRE (early 40's) stands a in the gin-clear water. He wears a scuffed and worn WETSU Frank exudes a quiet confidence. A man who keeps his own counsel. He's as hard and as cold as the caves he explore Frank’s eyes are closed in meditation as he rehearses emergency BAIL-OUT DRILLS. He moves with fluid clarity, a practising Tai-Chi.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Focus on the dive. (beat) High oxygen: close valve, diluent flush, engage manual flight. Good. You ain’t dying down there today. Low oxygen...(beat) Shit! Low oxygen.....- Frank SIGHS and opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That damn kid. Frank takes three deep BREATHS, closes his eyes and start the drills again. VOICES drift over from the far side of cave.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (0.S TEXAN DRAWL)
dialogues.text: That's the third time you checked that gauge. You sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) Just tired. You know... Sitting on the edge of the dive platform is CRAZY GEORGE (40's). George is a tall and wiry Texan who looks like a hippy. busy operating the joystick control of a CAVE MAPPING ROV JUDY 'JUDES' TREBLE (30's) stands in the water beside him She is wearing a CLOSED CIRCUIT REBREATHER and CAVE DIVIN EQUIPMENT. Judes is a serious-minded diver who likes to d things by the book. She also looks great in a wetsuit.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: You wanna cancel the dive?

dialogues.speaker: JUDES
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: No one'1ll blame you, Judes. He’s had you in the water seven days straight now. When the hell did you last see daylight? Judes looks up at George and forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES
dialogues.text: Three weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: Damn, girl. You’re starting to look like Gollum.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: Thanks, George.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Cave's still gonna be here next year...

dialogues.speaker: JUDES
dialogues.text: Try telling Frank that.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SERIOUS)
dialogues.text: You dive for yourself. Not for Frank. “Anyone can call the dive at any time for...”

dialogues.speaker: JUDES
dialogues.text: “,,.any reason.” I know.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: So. (beat) Why don’t you sit this one out? Judes deliberates. She looks yearningly toward her SLEEPI BAG at the rear of the cave. She looks tempted when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all set? FRANK wades toward them, zipping up his suit. His face is with an intense, determined look. He grabs his REBREATHER from the dive platform and fires up the electronics.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (FORCED CHEERFULNESS)
dialogues.text: Sure... She looks up at George and squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (WHISPERED)
dialogues.text: Last time, George. Promise. George hands Judes her mask.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna hold you to that.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ready as I'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: George, you in position? On George's LAPTOP, a DIGITAL IMAGE of the cave can be se marked DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Hundreds of BOULDERS stacked high. A gaping TUNNEL beneath them. Frank studies the scr

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. I still say she's teasin’ us, Frank. Ain't no way through that restriction.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Machines can't feel the cave, George. (TAPS the screen) This one goes. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (WEARILY)
dialogues.text: How many times have I heard that? BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! A RED LIGHT flashes above the communica tent. Frank, Judes and George look at one another in conc Crazy George staggers to his feet and hobbles into the te to answer the call. He walks with a pronounced LIMP.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (ANXIOUS)
dialogues.text: Rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're good for a few weeks yet. George pokes his head out of the tent.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: It's Carl. Frank’s face registers annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (SARCASTIC)
dialogues.text: Hallelujah! “Rich Boy” returns.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: He wants a word with you. Frank drags himself out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll bet he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slumps down into a chair, surrounded by high tech equipment and several MONITORS. Crazy George hovers in th background. Carl’s face can be seen on the DIVE COM. He doesn’t look happy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why are you using the emergency line?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I want a progress report.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (ANNOYED)
dialogues.text: You got me out of the water for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of high tech electronics, including several MONITO Frank's face fills the screen. Carl SLAMS the table.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (ANGRY)
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Frank! We’re running out of time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I’1l give you a progress report: we’re down here, busting our balls, while you fuck off to pick up your girlfriend. Victoria, Josh and the basecamp manager, JIM SERGEANT (36 hover in the background next to an enormous CAVE MAP. Jim Josh exchange a look: this is typical Frank.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Four months, Frank. I could have dug myself a bigger cave by now.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. This cave don’t follow your schedule. Put my son on the line. Victoria flashes Josh a sympathetic look. Josh SIGHS heav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl casts a final murderous glance at Frank before he disappears off screen. George shakes his head wearily.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: Nice. Keep on biting the hand that feeds us...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We earned the right to dive here, George. If that softcock wants a piece of this cave, he should try getting his hands dirty. On screen, Josh slouches into the chair and stares sullen

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (HOSTILE)
dialogues.text: (long beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You’re on my shitlist, mate.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You were assigned rope man. You’re supposed to be working here as part of the team, not off on some joy ride. 10 Josh stares at his feet and snorts derisively: it’s pret obvious he thinks his old man is a total dick.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (FURIOUS)
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said!?! Josh reaches forward and defiantly flicks a switch. The screen suddenly goes blank. Frank stares in disbelief. Cr George tries hard not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BASECAMP OFFICE
dialogues.text: Josh storms out, furious and humiliated. Victoria follows a few seconds later. She finds Josh around the back of th office, KICKING the wall. Josh slumps to the floor, head and BREATHING hard. Victoria places her hand on his shoulder. He gazes up at grateful for the attention. His eyes drift across her bod Victoria catches him checking her out. An awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank storms down to the water, Crazy George limping afte him.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY
dialogues.text: Go easy on him, Frank. The kid deserved a break. Frank wades into the water and starts kitting up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We’re all tuckered out. That don’t mean he can sneak off whenever he feels like it. Frank SPITS into his mask and winks at Judes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ready to rock?

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (FORCED ENTHUSIASM)
dialogues.text: First one to the tunnel “bags the booty”.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: In your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES, (SIGHS)
dialogues.text: Let's hope this is the one. 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the one. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: JUDES
dialogues.text: (beat) Then let's do it. They insert their mouthpieces, then grasp hands as a gest of “goodluck”. Venting their WINGS, they sink beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The divers descend toward an UNDERWATER DECOMPRESSION HABITAT, bolted to the walls at a depth of 30 ft. Each diver's REBREATHER has their name boldly stencilled acros the back. CLOSE-UP of Frank’s eyes behind his mask as he moves thro the water. His voice sounds tense and strained.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Focus. Forget the kid. This cave’1l kill you in a heartbeat if you let it. (beat) The cave always wins. The DECO HAB looks like a high-tech lunar landing module. DIVER PROPULSION VEHICLES (DPV's) and STAGE CYLINDERS hav been clipped to a DECO LINE that descends into the inky depths. The DPV's look like miniature torpedoes, fitted w handlebars. The divers collect their DPV's, clip on their STAGE CYLINDERS and power away into the inky depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VRRRRR! Powerful HID lights from the DPV's flit across th walls of an enormous underwater cavern. Frank follows a t GUIDELINE that snakes its way across the calcite-covered ceiling. The water is crystal clear: visibility a hundred feet or more. The REBREATHER'S lack of bubbles give the divers the appearance of astronauts, exploring inner spac Frank's voice begins to relax, becoming deep and reverent he recites Coleridge’s famous poem.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: In Xanadu did Kubla Khan. A stately pleasure dome decree. Where Alph, the sacred river, ran. Through caverns measureless to man. Down to a sunless sea. 12 They enter a room, where white FLOWSTONE covers the wall It's like a waterfall frozen in time. Stunningly beautifu Frank gazes in wonder as they pass amazing SPELEOTHEMS, connecting the floor to the ceiling. INT. DEEP TUNNEL. Frank and Judes power their DPV's into a long winding tun POV FRANK: the HEADS UP DISPLAY (HUD) clipped onto his REBREATHER MOUTHPIECE bathes his face a ghoulish green gl

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: 70 meters...80...90... BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! A red light flashes across Frank's face his REBREATHER HUD ALARM sounds.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Oxygen spike. Add some helium. PFFT! Frank calmly reaches down and pushes a button on hi COUNTERLUNGS. The HUD turns green again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: No worries. Where’s Judes? VRRRR! Judes overtakes Frank, aiming her DPV toward a nar gap in the tunnel. CRUNCH! Her REBREATHER clumsily scrape against the rock, bringing down a cloud of fine silt.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: (continuing) C'mon, Judy-babe. Tighten it up. Frank's eyes narrow in concentration as he follows her in the tunnel. The whirling blades of his DPV PROPELLER slow DISSOLVE INTO... EXT. BASECAMP — DAY THUDDA! THUDDA! THUDDA! The whirling rotor blades of a RUSSIAN KAMOV HELICOPTER as it hovers above basecamp. Operations manager, Jim Sergeant is marching across camp, trying to outpace Carl. Jim used to be a Royal Navy diver Right now, he wishes he was back defusing mines.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Do you think it’s worth me kitting up and going down there? 13 Basecamp is a hive of activity: LOCAL VILLAGERS unloadin OXYGEN CYLINDERS from a huge CRANE at the edge of the dol ENGINEERS inspecting an ELECTRICAL GENERATOR. BLENDING TECHNICIANS operating two large COMPRESSORS.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I doubt it. You want my opinion, Frank’s lost the fucking plot. The KAMOV touches down, creating a huge cloud of dust. Ji approaches one of the local villagers who is supervising unloading of OXYGEN CYLINDERS from the CRANE. Luko (24) speaks in a heavily accented PIDGIN ENGLISH. We catch maybe two words in three. He's a large, powerful ma Respected among his tribe and feared as a fierce warrior. Luko has a BEECH NUT CIGARETTE permanently glued to his bottom lip.

dialogues.speaker: LUKO, (PIDGIN ENGLISH)
dialogues.text: Numato! Tamairi! Yu-two fala ee kam long ples yia mo helpem me- fala. Mix master blong Jesus Christ! Two more VILLAGERS rush over and start loading empty CYLINDERS onto the KAMOV HELICOPTER. Jim removes the cigarette from Luko’s lips and crushes it out, nodding to the FLAMMABLE STICKER on the OXYGEN CYLINDER.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (FLUENT PIDGIN)
dialogues.text: Buy yu sackem-out cigarette blong you, eh? All tank yia ee save boom! Killem all dead. Jim marches over to the basecamp office, Carl doggedly following him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: “Mix master blong Jesus Christ?”

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: He means the helicopter. Josh suddenly bursts out of the office doorway, with Vict in tow. They are both rigged in CLIMBING HARNESSES. Jim g Josh in a friendly HEADLOCK on the bottom step.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Back in the doghouse, mate! Right where you belong. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised he even noticed I’d gone.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Oh, he noticed alright. Took hima full day to get down there without you.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: Must’ve been painful to watch.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Don’t look so chuffed. He’s put you on double rope duty for the rest of the week. Starting now. Josh SIGHS heavily. Victoria places her hand on his shoul

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (DISAPPOINTED)
dialogues.text: Josh was going to teach me how to rappel...

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: (long beat) Go on. I haven’t seen you.

dialogues.speaker: JOSE
dialogues.text: Yesss!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (she winks at Carl) You gonna come and hold my hand?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Not now!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. You have two-hundred emails waiting for you in there...

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: They can all fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: You should go with them, Carl. Try and enjoy the last few days. I’1l let you know if Frank finds anything. Jim disappears inside the office. TIGHT on Carl. He doesn look happy at all. 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim switches on the DIVE COM and gazes at the ROV MONITOR

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where are they, George?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Devil’s restriction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy George reaches forward and sharpens the digital ima from the ROV. The fuzzy picture shows Frank and Judes arriving at the restriction.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (FLICKING A SWITCH)
dialogues.text: And...let there be light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOMPH! Several HID lights fire up on the ROV, illuminat the cave as far as the eye can see. Thousands of BOULDERS cover the floor. The boulders have been ground smooth so resemble a pile of gigantic marbles. Judes 'parks' her DPV beneath a natural bridge in the boulders. A gaping black hole leading into the unknown. H DPV PROPELLER stirs up a cloud of SILT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, the image is obscured by silt. Crazy Geor grabs the joystick and powers the ROV upwards.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Bh, shit. Call the scuba police. Amateur alert! INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. The thick cloud of silt engulfs Judes and Frank, reducing visibility to zero.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Deep and slow. Panic kills. Clip on a reel. 16  POV FRANK: we can barely see his hands as he expertly attaches a SAFETY GUIDELINE to a rock in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Now rise above the situation. PFTTT! Frank adds gas to his WING. LINE rattles off his R INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. On screen, the ROV hovers patiently above the cloud of si George breathes a SIGH of relief as he watches Frank risi like a ghost, back into clear water. INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Frank can see Judes light in the cloud beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: She’s gonna be pissed about that. Alright, Frank: focus. Master controller: P-oh-two: fine. Slave: Fine. (PFT! The solenoid fires) There's your second heartbeat. (glances at wrist computer } Depth 98 meters. Run time’s good... Frank's eyes suddenly widen. He notices the silt cloud is being sucked into a hole in the boulders, thirty feet awa

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit! That’s the way through! The cloud of silt continues drifting toward the hole.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh man, that is strong flow! (gazing around the cave) Got you! Finally! (irritated) C'mon Judes, sort your shit out. Judes sheepishly drifts toward him and flashes an ‘okay' signal. She shakes her head, obviously annoyed with herse 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yeah, drinks are on you tonight. Frank flashes his light toward the new lead. They swim ov to investigate. INT. FORWARD BASE PLATFORM. Crazy George powers the ROV forward, illuminating Frank a Judes as they follow the silt toward the hole.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (WARY)
dialogues.text: Frank, what you doin’, Frank? The DIVE COM crackles.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he up to?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: He's smelled somethin’. The ROV focusses on a narrow tunnel winding its way into bowels of the earth. It’s a claustrophobic nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (WHISPERS)
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, Frank. Leave it. INT. DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. Frank tries squeezing into he tunnel, but the entrance is small. Judes watches apprehensively as Frank removes his REBREATHER. He reaches forward and scribbles a message on her WRIST SLATE. Judes gazes down at Frank’s message: “SHE GOES. TRUST ME! Holding his rebreather in front of him, Frank pushes into tight hole.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Why should I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (SHRUGS)
dialogues.text: I’m the only one around here who can climb for shit. 18 Victoria peers nervously over the edge of the doline. Jo clipping her onto a rope that disappears over the 1000ft drop. Victoria casts a weary look toward Carl. He is pacing alo the edge of the cliff, a SATELLITE PHONE glued to his ear

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Carl! Are we doing this or what? Carl lifts his hand, irritated. Victoria rolls her eyes a Josh.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) I swear they’d still manage to find him on the moon! Carl paces over and thrusts the phone into Victoria's han

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Deal with them will you? Tell them I'm uncontactable until further notice. Victoria throws the phone far over the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (SMILING SWEETLY)
dialogues.text: Dealt with. Carl looks suitably shocked.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: Sweet!

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CURT)
dialogues.text: I'll get my harness. Victoria inches her way to the edge of the precipice and braces herself, ready to rappel down. Carl starts pulling items of CLIMBING EQUIPMENT out of a FLIGHT CASE.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SMILING)
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on her, Josh. She’s terrified of heights! Victoria flashes Carl a knowing look. There’s clearly something going on.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (TO VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: No worries. Take it nice and easy, like I showed you. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won’t let me fall? Victoria squeezes his hand. Josh BLUSHES.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Promise. Clear below!

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER, (DISTANT 0.8)
dialogues.text: Climb when ready!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (CONFIDENT)
dialogues.text: Climbing! With a wink and a smile, Victoria suddenly throws herself backwards over the edge. ZZZZIP! Josh gazes in open jawed amazement as Victoria expertly completes the rappel in three bounces.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You can’t beat a woman who's into ropes. Josh looks gobsmacked.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SMILING)
dialogues.text: She‘s ex-professional. We met during the Everest expedition.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Wow. That must have been awesome.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Piece of piss after K2. Carl adjusts his climbing harness.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Life's not a dress-rehearsal, Josh. Sometimes you have to seize the day. Carl CLIPS himself onto the rope.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks says I reach the bottom before you. Josh GRINS, inverts himself and leaps off the edge of the cliff. 222ZZZ1P! Josh RUNS down the vertical cliff wall f 600 feet before applying the brake. He glances back up th cliff. Carl is nowhere in sight. 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loser! BOING! Josh bounces out into space, spinning in the sunli and emitting a WHOOP of delight. BADOOSH! He swings into glittering WATERFALL. The cascade shatters into a million droplets as the force of the water spins him around and around.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: No one can take this away! This is mine! I own it! Josh gazes down at the cave entrance and SHOUTS at the to his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the claustrophobic tunnel, things are getting tigh Frank’s face is contorted with the physical effort of pus his REBREATHER ahead of him. His breathing rate increases each BREATH sounds deafening inside the enclosed space. Suddenly, he wedges stuck. His HOSES and VALVES scrape against the sharp rock. Frank gazes nervously behind him. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. On the screen, Judes is still outside the tunnel, unclipp her STAGE BOTTLES. Crazy Gecrge paces in front of the monitor, clearly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (ON DIVECOM)
dialogues.text: Plan the dive and dive the plan, D'you recall hearing that somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BASECAMP OFFICE
dialogues.text: Jim has been joined by several EXPEDITION MEMBERS. They c around the monitor, eagerly watching the image.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -.--But, no. Our boy’s gotta go find himself a hole tighter than a nun’s nasty... 21 LAUGHTER from the team. This is the most excitement they had in months. They watch Judes squeezing her way into th tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER
dialogues.text: 100 meters with no bailout. That is hardcore, man.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m goin’ after them... The team watch the ROV power forward, BUMPING and GRINDIN it‘s way down the tunnel. BRRRR! BRRRR! A SATELLITE PHONE rings in the background. Jim snatches it up.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Hello? (SIGHS heavily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands in the middle of the clearing, adjusting a complicated-looking HARNESS clipped to his chest. The BASECAMP OFFICE DOOR flies open.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (HOLDING THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: Carl! For you. Again. Carl suddenly turns and races toward the edge of the clif

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Tell them to...fuck...off! Carl LEAPS into the doline.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh is half-way down the cliff face when he hears an almighty SHRIEK from above. He looks up to see Carl falli toward him. Josh instinctively hugs the cliff wall.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Below! cur TO: The EXPEDITION TEAM scatter and drop as Carl falls toward them. Victoria gazes up, open jawed.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: oh, Christ!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 22 Carl hurtles past Josh in a blur. WHOOMPTH! His BASE JUM PARACHUTE deploys at 200ft.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yeee-ha! Carl steers the CHUTE expertly down toward the clearing. expedition team gaze up in shocked amazement. Luko has ne seen a parachute before. Victoria's face is a mask of ang

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (BELLOWING)
dialogues.text: Carl! You reckless son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is still wedged stuck in the narrow tunnel. Flakes rock dance around him. He’s now PANTING in exertion.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Deep and slow. Panic’s a vulture, sat on your shoulder, waiting. There's always slack somewhere, Frank. Try backing up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Further back in the tunnel, Judes can see Frank backing o toward her. As she tries to turn around, one of her BREAT HOSES gets snagged on a sharp outcrop of rock. Judes WREN it free, bringing down flakes of rock and silt.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank starts CHANTING, mantra style as he edges his way forward again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: In Xanadu...did Kubla Khan...A stately pleasure dome...decree... Ahead of him, the tunnel opens up into a gaping black voi

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Christ, would you look at that. It's wide open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pulls himself out of a crack in an underwater cliff re-dons his rebreather. 23 Sudden vertigo as his torch reveals a gaping black abyss sign of the walls or ceiling. Below him, the cave plummet infinity.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! This is what it’s all about! No-one has ever seen this. No one! Here. Now. This is who you are, Frank Mcguire! A flash of light behind him. Judes pulls herself out of t tunnel, her eyes wide with excitement. She shakes a fragm of rock from her REBREATHER and puts it back on. VRRRRRR! The ROV pops out of the tunnel, filling the cham with light. The cave is monstrous. The ROV’s lights just manage to paint the far walls. Frank and Judes hang in th abyss, like two fireflies inside a cathedral. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATION TENT. Crazy George can’t drag his eyes away from the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (AWE-INSPIRED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Jim, tell me y’all getting this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and the team members stare at the monitor in hushed amazement.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s amazing.(beat) Somebody better fetch Carl. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That stubborn son of a bitch. He finally did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Judes hover in the abyss, gazing in awestruck wonder at the new cave.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Heh! Judy-babe, we have scored big time. This place is... 24  Frank’s eyes suddenly narrow in concern. BUBBLES are streaming from Judes REBREATHER. Frank swims over to her. Frank signals she has a small leak. Judes looks confused. spins around so Frank can take a closer look. Frank notic small tear in the BREATHING HOSE, where it attaches to th COUNTERLUNGS. Frank reaches forward to examine the hose. BADOOSH! The hose suddenly pops free from the REBREATHER. Bubbles EXPLODE as Judes ALARM starts to scream. Red ligh bathes the cave. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! Judes starts to sink. She signals to Fr still relatively calm: “out of air”. Frank duck-dives down to her. He removes his own mouthpie and offers it. Judes gulps down several BREATHS. They are sinking fast, Judes struggling to locate her WING INFLATO PFFFT! Frank starts pumping air into his WING to arrest t descent. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! His REBREATHER HUD ALARM flash red as his oxygen spikes. Judes now looks really scared. By now, Frank is desperate to breathe himself. He gently pulls the mouthpiece away from Judes. She's reluctant to it go. Frank pulls harder. BLAM! Judes is suddenly all over Frank in a frenzy, a loo blind panic on her face. She claws at Frank’s face, rippi off his mask. POV Frank: A blurred red nightmare as Judes attacks him. Frank backs away, struggling to restrain her. Her attack grows weaker and weaker until... BLOOMPTH! A final exhalation of bubbles as she finally ta water into her lungs. Frank releases her and pulls out hi back-up mask. POV Frank: his vision clears as he empties the mask of wa Frank watches Judes spiral down into the darkness. Her li eventually disappears. INT. FORWARD BASE COMMUNICATIONS TENT. Crazy George gazes at the screen in horror. Frank turns a looks directly at the ROV CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet Jesus, no... 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXCITED CHATTER as Carl, Josh, Victoria and Luko travel u the METAL CAGE attached to the CRANE. Carl is showing Jos the BASE JUMP HARNESS. The cage clears the edge of the cl Jim stands waiting for them, looking white as a sheet. Ot expedition members stand in utter shock. Some of them are CRYING. In an instant, all the color drains from Josh's f

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: He's dead. I wished it. It's my fault. I killed him. Jim steps forward and places his hand on Josh's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Your Dad's fine. TIGHT on Josh: unable to disguise his relief. dim casts an angry glance at Carl, who stands holding his BASE JUMP CHUTE.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (DISDAIN)
dialogues.text: They just broke this cave for you, Hurley. (beat) Judes didn't make it. TIGHT on Carl as he takes this in. INT. UNDERWATER DECO HABITAT - 8 HOURS LATER. A small bell-shaped structure, large enough to accommodat four divers. Frank dozes on a bunk with a regulator in hi mouth. His REBREATHER is tethered in the MOONPOOL. George reaches over and nudges Frank awake.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Off o2. Frank sits up.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) How you doin’? Frank GROANS and buries his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: 104 subtract 7. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, George, give me a break...

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Start callin’ the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (WEARY)
dialogues.text: Ci |

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Alright. I reckon you're clear. (long beat) Jesus, Frank. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Breathing hose. Ripped clean out of her counterlung. She must’ve loosened it going through the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Or maybe she was too tired to check it before the dive?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You think I killed her?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Down here, it’s all about knowing when to quit. You taught me that. Frank considers this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I should go back for her.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ain't no way you’re draggin’ a body back through that restriction. (beat) No. This is how she wanted it. Hell, she even used to joke: "you can't get buried...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ",..deeper for cheaper" Frank and George smile sadly. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let’s get you out of here. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge bonfire in the center of the village. DRUMS beat a solemn rhythm as the LOCAL SHAMAN leads a dozen VILLAGERS a DEATH RITE around the fire. Their painted bodies gliste the firelight. Other VILLAGERS watch from the shadows. Scattered among them are several EXPEDITION MEMBERS, look utterly defeated. A couple of them are still crying. Josh, Carl and Victoria sit inside an open hut. Luko sits with them, preparing coconut shells of KAVA. He chews on root from a pepper plant and SPITS the intoxicating resid into the shells.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: .--until you've experienced it, you'll never understand! Any fool can climb a mountain. Who knows where this cave leads?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (ANGRY)
dialogues.text: Who fucking cares? Death toll’s up to three now...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (TO CARL)
dialogues.text: You never told me that.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Ten years ago, two divers stumbled across this system. Real experienced, I mean, they'd been pushing caves for thirty years...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No-one knows. Their equipment was washed up twenty miles away. In the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Who...fucking...cares?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: It's a tired old world, Josh. Where else do you get to shine a light where no man has been before?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You wanna see something no-one’s seen before? 28  Josh picks up a COCONUT SHELL and rolls it to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Crack that open.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SCATHING)
dialogues.text: You just don’t get it, do you? You carry on climbing your mountains "because they’re there'. (beat) We're doing it because it's NOT there.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: And that's worth dying for is it?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Judes thought so. A moment as they consider this.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (TO CARL)
dialogues.text: You think Frank'1ll cancel the expedition?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: He can't. He needs it.(beat) More than any of us. Luko SPITS into the shell and offers them the kava.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (DISGUSTED)
dialogues.text: He expects us to drink that?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Kava. To honor Judes. Josh takes the shell and gulps down the intoxicating brew Carl watches in horror as Victoria reaches for the shell. shrugs at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I’ve swallowed worse. Victoria downs it in one.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Wow! I can feel my lips going numb already. Carl reaches forward and nervously takes the shell. 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. Carl sips it, gingerly, holding his nose as he does so. Victoria takes perverse satisfaction in watching his discomfort. Carl GAGS and races out into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lightweight. Victoria staggers to her feet and follows Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh man! That shit is really good. Suddenly, the DRUMS stop beating. Silence descends upon t village. Josh's intoxicated mind reels from the kava as h turns to see: Frank, stepping out of the shadows, looking utterly exhausted. He is caked in mud and looks like a primordial nightmare. George appears behind him. The villagers WHISP nervously as they watch Frank approach the expedition members. Jim steps forward and offers his condolences. Ot team members walk away in disgust. Josh closes his eyes. A shadow falls across Josh's face. He looks up to see Fra standing above him. Josh tenses as Frank sits next to him long awkward silence. The drums continue their mournful heartbeat, building in intensity over the following:

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (FINALLY)
dialogues.text: Look. If you're gonna bollock me, just get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You wanna quit drinking that shit. Makes you sound dopier than you really are.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You should try it. (under his breath) God knows you need it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You enjoy showing off for your new mates? 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least I got mates.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I told you to stay away from Carl. He collects people. (beat) Uses them. Josh finally turns and looks at his father.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He reckons you’re going back in. (beat) Says that's what Judes would have wanted. Frank SNORTS derisively.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's what Carl wants.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: And you don’t? Frank looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You dive caves for long enough, this kind of thing happens. Judes knew the risks, better than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (MUMBLING)
dialogues.text: She knew how much you wanted this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Look, nobody forced Judes to do anything!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're full of shit, mate. You haven't a fucking clue what you're talking about. You been hanging around with the yuppie too long. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least he treats me like an adult.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well. Soon as you start acting like an adult, I'll consider treating you like one...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (SUDDENLY ANGRY)
dialogues.text: You know what? Why don't you just...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: FUCK OFF
dialogues.text: The drums suddenly stop dead.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (A WEARY WHISPER)
dialogues.text: .--Leave me alone. Frank gets up and walks away. Josh watches him disappear.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: I will never be like you. Never. INT. JUDES'S TENT -— CONTINUOUS Frank opens the flap to Judes’ tent and steps inside. His torch reveals a clutter of SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT and DIVE GEAR. Frank empties Judes’s rucksack. He picks up her ADD BOOK and starts searching for a number. A photograph fall out: Judes with her HUSBAND and BABY. Frank stares at the picture. EXT. JUDES‘S TENT - CONTINUOUS The silhouette of Frank: his shoulders ROCKING in grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is doubled up in the bushes, DRY RETCHING from the k Victoria stands over him, rubbing his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Shhh! Listen! A distant CHANTING, carried on the wind. Curious, she staggers to the edge of the clearing to investigate. 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, baby. D-don’t leave me!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Quit whining. Victoria stumbles her way through the thick jungle. She’s still pretty intoxicated from the kava. An owl SHRIEKS, startling her. She listens again. Silence. Then a twig SN

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Who's there? The CHANTING starts again. Victoria nervously pushes forw She emerges into a clearing at the edge of the doline. At the edge of the doline, the KASTOM SHAMAN is surrounde several villagers performing an ancient PURIFICATION RITE The Shaman’s grotesque DEATH MASK glints in the moonlight he incants a solemn PRAYER. Victoria turns to leave. BLAM! Luko suddenly looms over her, swaying in a kava-ind trance. He doesn’t seem to recognize her. Victoria GASPS fright. After a few seconds, Luko staggers past her towar the ceremony. Josh steps out of the shadows, grabs Victoria’s hand and pulls her back into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (HUSHED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Jesus! You scared me to death...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sssh! You’re not supposed to be here!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Judes death really freaked them out. They’re trying to appease the cave spirits.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Cave spirits?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: The ones that took Judes soul. Victoria watches the Shaman lift some BURNING EMBERS high above his head. The villagers WHISPER to each other as th PRAYER continues. Some of them look really frightened. 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he saying?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He’s warning them to stay out of the cave. The SHAMAN launches the burning embers over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN, (PIDGIN ENGLISH)
dialogues.text: All man whair oh-lee gat “Only those...pure of straight heart mo oh-lee gat spirit...can enter and gud tinktink ee sa-vay go survive”. inside long taboo... The embers flare for a few seconds and then are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK walks back toward the basecamp office, with Judes ADDRESS BOOK. He’s about to open the door when he hears RAISED VOICES from inside. POV Frank: Through the window, he sees Jim, Crazy George the expedition team huddled around the monitor. They're watching ROV footage from Judes death.

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..-he had no fucking right taking her through that restriction without bailout! It was an accident waiting to happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens the door. Everyone falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (long beat) Excuse me. I’ve a phone call to make. The team start to filter out. Many of them won’t look at Frank. Jim and Crazy George pause on their way out the do

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’ve downloaded the data from the ROV. Frank nods grimly. 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should take a look at it, Frank. Before you make your decision. They leave. Frank slumps down into the chair, staring at phone. He glances at the MONITOR marked CAVE MAPPER. Fran can't help himself. He powers it up and gazes in disbelie a 3-D DIGITAL IMAGE of the cave scrolls across the screen The new section is massive: a huge air-filled chamber disappears into the unknown, the way forward marked with QUESTION MARK. A NOISE behind him. Frank spins around. Carl stands gazin the screen. He’s still looking green from the kava.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There's a rumor around camp that you're pulling the plug. I want to know if it's true. (beat) What happened today was a tragedy, Frank. But Columbus lost half his crew pushing the unknown...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Imposter. Drunk on opiates .«--We value life differently from a shallow world. Chasing now. It's become too damn dreams of immortality. (beat) important. You think Judes You've sold your soul. Now died with regret? Hell, no. deal with it. She died chasing her dream.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: --.I don't think she would forgive us if we quit now.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (EXPLODING)
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what Judes would think! You didn't see her die. You weren't even there!

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (EXPLODING)
dialogues.text: I fucking paid to be there! Don't forget that!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (SNARLING)
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry, Hurley. When I make my decision, I’1ll let you know. An awkward pause. Carl suddenly turns on the charm. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, Frank. What you've achieved here is remarkable. He studies the new cave on the ROV MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (REVERENT WHISPER)
dialogues.text: She's the mother of all caves. No one's ever broke her. Until now. Carl turns to Frank with a gleam in his eye. He TAPS his finger against the question mark on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Put my name on a piece of this, Frank. And I'll die a happy man. Carl leaves. Frank continues staring at the frozen image the cave. Huge. Inviting. Irresistible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS ESTABLISHING SHOTS as the sun edges its way over rainforest. Mist rising from the doline. Parrots preening their plumage. Chickens and pigs in the kastom village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embers from the dying fire rise slowly in the pre-dawn ai Josh lies fast asleep outside Luko's hut. He's still full clothed from the night before. A BOOT rudely KICKS him aw Josh's eyes fly open. Frank stands looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Get up. I want everyone assembled in twenty minutes. Frank marches off. Josh gazes after him, still hungover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and George are huddled around the computer. Frank T his fingers absently along to an AC-DC TUNE that’s playin the background. He’s studying a SATELLITE IMAGE of a STOR

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I reckon you got three days.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: If she changes direction, Jim can give us a shout on the blower. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36  FRANK (cont'd) She’1l hit the backside of the mountain first. That'll give us eight hours before the river starts to flood. Plenty of time to leg it back up.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can help you get Carl and Victoria down to Forward Base.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Cheers, George. We'll take the yuppie for a quick paddle around “the great unknown”. Let him name his fucking rock so we can all get the hell out of here. Jim walks in, Josh trailing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO JIM)
dialogues.text: Is everyone ready?

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (SHAKING HIS HEAD)
dialogues.text: Luko’s men are too spooked to go back in.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beat) We can manage without them. What about the others?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Sorry, Frank. They don't want anything to do with this. Frank considers this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They’re scared.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (ANGRY)
dialogues.text: Of course they’re scared! Aren't you? Crazy George and Jim exchange a look. They decide to leav

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. Every time. Josh looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The day you ain’t scared before a dive is the day you stop diving. 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sphincter of fucking rock! You think that’s worth dying for?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Stop being a drama queen. Frank heads toward the door. Josh blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Step aside, Josh! A moment of tension between them. Josh eventually allows Frank to pass. Frank marches outside. TIGHT on Josh: a worried expression on his face. He glanc at the CAVE MAP on the wall. Frank has already pencilled the section where Judes died. The new cavern is marked ‘J Jewel’. The final strains of the AC-DC SONG drift from Frank's old CASETTE PLAYER.

dialogues.speaker: AC-DC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “I’m on a highway to hell...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud ARGUMENT rages between several VILLAGERS, includin Luko. MACHETES have been drawn and tempers flare. Frank, Crazy George, Carl and Victoria watch the argument from the edge of the doline. They are kitted up and ready rappel. Frank looks up to find Josh standing there, weari his waterproofs and climbing harness.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (SULLEN)
dialogues.text: What you said. You need a rope man.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You made your position clear. We don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Jesus, Frank. Give the kid a break... Frank flashes Carl a murderous look. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you stay the fuck out of this. (to Josh) The chopper leaves at ten o’clock. Give my regards to your mother. Josh stares at his father. Bristling in pure hatred. Then turns and marches away.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Josh... Frank shoulders his pack and threads his FIVE BAR RACK in the descent rope.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Frank, stop. (beat) If he leaves now, you'll never see him again. Frank ignores her and leans back over the edge of the cli

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm going back for him. Okay? A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay? Frank looks up at Victoria. Then nods his head, imperceptibly. ZIIIIP! Frank disappears over the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's a wonder the boy's not in therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria chases after Josh. She sees him storm away into jungle. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh! Josh, come back! But Josh has gone.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAVE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: The river CASCADES into the cave across a series of treacherous rocks, breached by a rickety ROPE BRIDGE. Mis fills the air. VARIOUS SHOTS as the team enter the cave: Luko waits for them by the entrance. He MUMBLES a quiet PRAYER as he scoops RED MUD from a shell and paints each member's face. Crazy George accepts the ritual solemnly. Carl follows. He can't take the ritual seriously.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TO VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: I guess they do this for all the tourists? Victoria next. As Luko paints her face, she glances nervo up at the blue sky framing the entrance to the cave. Acut aware this might be the last time she sees it. Frank brings up the rear. He gazes reverently around the as Luko performs the ritual. He is about to step into the shadows when he notices a TINY FIGURE perched on the edge the doline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sits dejected on the edge of the cliff, watching Fra A moment passes between them. Then Frank steps into the darkness. Josh closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JOSH'S TENT
dialogues.text: Josh lies in his sleeping bag, fast asleep. The distant rumble of THUNDER jolts him awake. Josh sits up. A dull R can be heard, like a far-away train. He sticks his head o of the tent. 40  Josh's eyes widen in alarm: the sky CRACKLES as a fierce ELECTRICAL STORM rages on the horizon. Josh staggers out toward the lights of the basecamp office.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BASECAMP OFFICE
dialogues.text: As Josh approaches the office, it’s clear that something very wrong. The remaining team members are crowded anxiou around the open doorway, whispering nervously to each oth RAISED VOICES can be heard coming from within. Jim is shouting into the DIVE COM.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Forward Base, forward base, this is basecamp, over. Do you read? Christ, Frank pick up! Josh peers in through the window. The team are huddled ar the MONITOR watching a satellite image of the approaching STORM. Everyone looks really scared.

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, the comms are down!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: There's plenty of signal. Just no one’s answering.

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER
dialogues.text: Send someone down, for Christ’s sake! Before it’s too late!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: It's too risky! The river’s already up two feet.

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! You can’t just leave them down there!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: They’re probably on their way back up...

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION MEMBER
dialogues.text: It's been over six hours now. If they don't leave soon... The sentence hangs in the air. Everyone is fully aware of implications. Jim grabs the DIVE COM. 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward Base, forward base, this is basecamp, over... Josh slips back into the shadows before anyone notices he there. INT. JOSH’S TENT - NIGHT Josh sits in the entrance to his tent, unable to sleep. H gazes toward the basecamp office, where several team memb continue to ARGUE with each other. Others hang around, impotent and useless. Josh gazes at the approaching storm and glances nervously his INDIGLO DIVEWATCH. A sudden CRACK of thunder startles him. The storm is clearly getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fuck it! Josh sits up and angrily starts pulling on his boots.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fuck him. Fucking idiot. EXT. CLIFF AT TOP OF DOLINE — NIGHT A thousand stars splinter the night sky. A full moon cast ghostly pall over the camp. Josh stands at the edge of th doline wearing his waterproofs and climbing harness. The ROAR from the waterfall has increased dramatically. N longer a gentle cascade, the powerful torrent CASCADES fa out over the cliff wall, plunging violently into the cave below. Josh deliberates. He stares down at the maelstrom white-water CRASHING its way into the cave. It looks scar as hell. Looking up, Josh notices a figure watching him from the opposite side of the doline. The grotesque MASK of the Sh glints in the moonlight. A serene look suddenly spreads across Josh's face. In an instant he’s calm and confident.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: “Only those pure of spirit”. Josh steps off the cliff and drops into the darkness. 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria's flashlight flickers on. Her eyes dart around i confusion as she tries to figure out what woke her. The NOISE from the stream has increased dramatically. The level of the water in the lake has risen to the point whe it's drenched the bottom of her sleeping bag. She KICKS C awake and stumbles across to Frank. Frank sits bolt uprig as Victoria’s light flits across his face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (URGENT WHISPER)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wake the others. Quickly. Frank pulls on his boots, grabs his flashlight and scramb toward the flooded communication tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the electronics are dead, submerged under two feet of water. Frank grabs the DIVE COM.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Basecamp, basecamp... Frank flicks a switch. FZZZT! A burst of SPARKS as the sy shorts out. Frank races back outside. EXT. FORWARD BASE. Frank marches toward the sump. The other team members are already gathered on the shoreline. Their combined lights reveal a disturbing sight: the cave is flooding, the wate level rising so fast, they can actually see it creeping u the shore. Frank has to SHOUT to be heard above the noise the water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We can't stay here! Secure the equipment!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Fuck the equipment! Let's just get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're assuming we can. Silence as the team considers this. Luko looks terrified. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Start kitting up. All of you. The team race around the camp, securing gear and pulling their WETSUITS. Frank feeds rope through a CEILING BOLT. George helps secure the REBREATHERS to the rope.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to the early warning system?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (FURIOUS)
dialogues.text: Christ knows. Those fuckers had better not be asleep up there! Stand clear! Frank HEAVES on the rope and hauls the REBREATHERS toward ceiling of the cave, where they are tied off and secured. team start donning their climbing harnesses. George passe rope and CLIPS everyone together.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) All right, listen up. This is gonna get real nasty. Keep a close eye on the person in front. Frank starts tearing excess gear off Carl and Victoria’s harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Stay on the rope. Three points of contact at all times.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (NERVOUS)
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. Try not to fuck up. The team wade out into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raging river surges through miles of narrow passagewa living force of water that threatens to destroy all in it path. Chest deep in the icy flow, the exploration team battle t way upstream. Tethered by a single rope, each team member braces themselves against the torrent. 44 Water POUNDS their bodies, threatening to dash them agai the sharp rocks lining the riverbed walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team pull themselves out of the surging river, onto a wide ledge at the base of a 50ft Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (BREATHLESS)
dialogues.text: W-Where to now? Frank flicks his light upwards: the COMMUNICATION CABLE disappears into a narrow tunnel at the top of the cliff. tunnel is half-flooded. A powerful GEYSER of water shoots several feet out over the cliff edge, before crashing int deep pool below them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Through there.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (DESPAIRING)
dialogues.text: We'll never make it! Luko starts muttering a PRAYER. He’s clearly terrified.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wait here. Frank scrambles up the cliff face and cautiously approach the water-filled tunnel. His feet slip and slide on the treacherous rocks. Bracing himself against the tunnel wal Frank sneaks a look upstream: the tunnel is impassable, t flow too strong. Frank sags. Then he sees a FLASH of light on the other si of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (BELLOWING)
dialogues.text: Who’s there?! No answer. Then a familiar voice, barely audible against ROAR of the water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Dad? Frank's expression changes from shock, to fear, then to anger.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh? What the hell are you doing? 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to tell you...the cave’s flooding! Frank shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No shit! (furious) Why didn’t they call us?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They've been trying all night! Your comms are switched off! Frank's eyes narrow in confusion. He casts a suspicious glance at Carl, far below.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CALLING UP)
dialogues.text: Is someone up there? INT. ABOVE FIREHOSE CLIFF. Josh is surrounded by a THUNDERING mass of white-water rapids. He is sheltering behind a GIGANTIC ROCK wedged midstream. Plumes of water jet high around him: it’s all can do to avoid being sucked down into the gaping tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Feed us the rope! Josh removes a 50 METER ROPE from around his neck. He gla around for an anchor point and loops the rope around the boulder he’s sheltering behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank catches the rope as it shoots out of the tunnel. He hoists it out of the water. ZIIIP! Josh slides two JUMARS down the rope to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Luko pushes past Carl and Crazy George and starts scrambl up the cliff toward Frank. Blind panic in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Frank! Before Frank can stop him, Luko has grabbed the rope and pulled himself into the tunnel. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luko! No!

dialogues.speaker: LUKO
dialogues.text: Me mus run way out long ples yia! PFFFFFT! The water hits Luko like a sledgehammer, knockin the wind out of him and causing him to CRY OUT in pain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CREAK! The BOULDER that Josh has lashed the rope around suddenly lurches forward an inch. Josh's eyes widen in fe He YELLS down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Stop! There’s too much weight!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Luko uses brute force to pull himself up the tunnel, his takes the full brunt of the flow.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Luko! Use the jumars! Streamline yourself!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CREAK! Josh sees the BOULDER tilt toward him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Luko! Go back!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Luko braces himself and HEAVES on the rope.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! Look out! cur To: Josh spins around just in time to see the BOULDER come CRASHING toward him. The force of the water, combined wit Luko’s weight has turned it into a fearsome projectile. Josh leaps forward to escape being crushed. The river suc him down into the tunnel. CRUNCH! The BOULDER slams into tunnel entrance, sealing it shut.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 47 Luko and Josh fly out of the tunnel like champagne corks They SLAM into Frank, knocking him over the edge of the cliff. BADOOSH! All three plunge into the pool below. The waterfall suddenly ceases to flow. Luko surfaces, COUGHING and SPLUTTERING. He scrambles to base of the cliff and drags himself out of the water. George and Victoria help pull Frank toward shore. He's ba winded. Josh fights his way back to the surface at the far side o the pool and is almost sucked downstream. He grabs a rock the edge of the pool and pulls himself out of the flow. VARIOUS REACTION SHOTS as the team gaze up at the tunnel where the waterfall used to be. An eerie silence fills th cave. Then a strange GROANING sound, like a human voice. cliff wall starts CREAKING, as though trying to communica Frank's eyes widen in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Everyone back down the tunnel! Move!

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TERRIFIED)
dialogues.text: W-What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s punching a way through! BLAM! A fist-sized section of the cliff wall flies toward them as the water blasts a new route downstream. POP! POP! POP! More sections of the cliff wall explode ar them. A large STALACTITE falls from the ceiling, narrowly missing Josh. The cave fills with SPRAY and NOISE. Luko starts scrambling back up the rope just as... BADOOM! A HISSING, MALEVOLENT geyser of spray SMASHES int him like a thousand firehoses combined. He is blasted thr the air and SLAMMED into the far cave wall. Luko crumples falls into the river. He is immediately washed downstream

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! Grab him! Josh is frozen in shock and unable to move. Luko breaks t surface and reaches toward him, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! Help him, for fuck's sake! 48  Josh watches helplessly as Luko is washed away into the darkness. VARIOUS SHOTS as the team react to Luko’s death. All eyes eventually turn from Josh to Frank. Frank gazes around the cave, sizing up his adversary. The chamber is quickly filling with water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're heading back down.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What? No!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We stay here, we'll be drowned like rats.(beat) We’ve got to find higher ground.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (DESPAIRING)
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (long beat) Through the restriction. VARIOUS REACTION SHOTS as they take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire cavern is almost underwater. The team wade, ch deep, through the muddy water, pushing their way through floating debris.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Grab anything that looks useful. George, prep the ‘breathers.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Victoria's hands are SHAKING in fright as she practices opening and closing the REBREATHER MOUTHPIECE. Frank is b adjusting her harness.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ...Try and think of it as a normal night dive. George’ll be with you every step of the way... 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought George can’t dive anymore?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're taking him out of retirement.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (NERVOUS)
dialogues.text: Just how tight does it get down there, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's a body tube. Same as you've done in dry cave, but with water. (beat) You gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (beat) I guess I’1l have to be.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Carl and George are stuffing CLIMBING ROPES into a bag.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: How the hell does he know the cave isn't flooded past that restriction?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Frank reckons it’s clear. That’s all you need to know. Crazy George eyes the rising water.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) One thing's for sure: stay here and y'all better start growing gills.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: In the far section of the cavern, Josh wades through the water, grabbing anything that looks useful. Suddenly, he freezes: in front of him, wrapped around a rock, is Luko' body. It's a ghastly sight. The river has broken every bo in his body. His jaw is almost hanging off. Josh shudders

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...I’m sorry...I’m SOrry... Luko opens his eyes. Josh jumps in fright. 50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! Someone bring the medical kit! The others wade over and stand horrified. Frank takes one look at Luko and throws the medical kit away. He leans forward to examine him. Luko tries to speak. Bloody froth pours from his broken jaw.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Easy. Don't try to talk.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: How bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (long beat) Leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: George, take Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No, wait. What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm going to take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (HORRIFIED)
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, no. No! Carl puts his arm around Victoria. She shrugs him off.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You have to help him! Josh turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (continuing) Tell him! He has to do something. 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? He's broken every bone in his body. He can't hold a reg in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You can't just leave him to die.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't intend to.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No! You have no right to do this!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: C'mon Josh, let’s go...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Get your fucking hands off me!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: George, get him away from here!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: You're going to kill him, aren't you? (beat) You murdering bastard. Frank suddenly explodes in anger and frustration.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (FURIOUS)
dialogues.text: You haven't a fucking clue have you? Any of you! You've spent your whole lives wrapped in cotton wool. You wanna play at being adventurers? Well welcome to the show! First prize - you get to live, second prize, you don’t. Boo- fucking-hoo! Silence as they consider this. Victoria steps forward, le toward Luko and kisses his hand. Luko MOANS in pain. Vict starts to WEEP. Carl leads her away.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: George. I'm begging you. Please don't let him do this!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Come away, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (PLEADING)
dialogues.text: There must be something we can do? Anything. 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is: you can do as Frank says. Josh stands helpless. After a few seconds, he follows Cra George into the darkness. Frank approaches his old friend Though barely conscious, Luko seems to understand what mu be done. cur TO: Josh flashes his light back toward his father. Frank is holding Luko's head beneath the surface of the water. Jos shudders and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team float upon the surface of the moon pool, wearing full DIVE EQUIPMENT. Frank surfaces. Josh still can't bri himself to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (GRIM)
dialogues.text: That’s it. It’s tetally flooded. A moment as they take this in.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (TO VICTORIA AND CARL)
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's start the buddy checks... Frank swims over to check Josh's REBREATHER.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So I finally managed to get you into one of these...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (FLINCHING)
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me! An awkward silence. Frank reaches forward and tugs on Jos harness, tightening his straps. Josh avoids eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Keep hold of the line at all All gasses on? Okay. Start times...I taught you how to callin' the numbers... clear your mask?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH CARL
dialogues.text: Yeah. A hundred times. Oxygen 200. Trimix 220.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Show me. Buoyancy and bailout? 53  Josh SIGHS and demonstrates the technique.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Good. You keep your mouthpiece in at all times. Flood the breathing loop and it’s all over...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (PROVOCATIVE)
dialogues.text: Like Judes, you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (NOT BITING)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just like Judes.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Look, I remember how to dive! Carl has already taken me through it...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well now you get to hear it twice. Green light's good, red light's bad. I'11 monitor your PPO2 and decompression. You remember what I told you about decompression sickness?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Close your mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Here, let me...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (ANNOYED)
dialogues.text: I’m fine!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Trimix set to 10/80? Gradient factors 15/85? High setpoint at 1.2? Bubble checks? Okay folks, we’re good to go... No, ‘cause I'm stupid. Crazy George suddenly leans over and grabs Josh.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hey! You wanna end up like me? Josh says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then you better smarten up. You get bent down here, it’s gonna ruin your whole day.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (SARCASTIC)
dialogues.text: And our day was going so well.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO JOSH AND VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: We'll have about four hours of decompression to do once we reach the other side. Stay at the same depth as me, or your blood'll start fizzing like a dropped soda. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.(acid to Carl) You actually choose to do this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: All right, let's visualize the dive. Visibility’s gonna be stirred to shit, so we can’t use the DPV’s. We have a long swim to the restriction. Stay behind me at all times and pace yourselves. The tunnel gets real tight in places. Don't freak out if it silts up. Just stay on the line and wait for it to clear.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: You want me to bring up the rear?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll lead, followed by Josh, then Carl, then you. (beat) Victoria at the back. Victoria glares at Frank. The implication is clear: Frank worried she'll panic.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
