dialogues.text: (continuing) Focus on breathing. Deep and slow. One person loses it down there, we all die. Victoria looks sick with fright.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (PATRONIZING)
dialogues.text: You can do this, baby. Be brave. Victoria glares at him murderously.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Everyone clear on the plan?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Basically, we follow you, keep breathing and hope nothing beeps. Frank and Crazy George exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: That's about the gist of it. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any questions? No one says a word.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’1l see you on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (DEADPAN)
dialogues.text: Not literally, I hope? Frank flashes the “down” signal. They sink beneath the surface. INT. UNDER THE DECO HABITAT. The water turns a dirty, blood-red ochre as the divers fo Frank into the 'mixing zone'. Their powerful HID LIGHTS barely penetrate the thick clouds of silt that dance and swirl across their face masks. A surreal descent into a pinkish cloud of ghostly shadows. Frank locates the GUIDELINE and wraps Josh's hand firmly around it. Josh follows Frank’s fins into the murk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS as a thick shroud of silt cocoons the diver Frank appears out of the gloom, his thumb and forefinger circled around the GUIDELINE. He sweeps his arm up and do through the murk, like a blind man using a cane. He passe several plastic CAVE ARROWS, clipped to the line at intervals, pointing the way back out. Suddenly, the cave materializes in Frank's HID LIGHT. Josh jumps in fright as Frank’s face suddenly looms out o the dark. They exchange “okay” signals and descend along cave wall. CRUMP! Carl bangs into the cave wall, dislodging a huge STALACTITE. He YELLS a muffled warning into his mouthpiec Crazy George CURSES as the STALACTITE whizzes by, narrowl missing him. Victoria tightens her grip around Crazy Geor wrist. They continue onward. 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leads the divers along the GUIDELINE until they rea the claustrophobic tunnel. It’s barely visible through th milky white-out. Victoria's eyes widen when she sees how tight the restric is. We hear her BREATHING increase as she fights the risi wave of panic. Frank circles his flashlight: ‘okay?' He receives a shaky signal back from her. Frank and George remove the EQUIPMENT PACKS from their harness and clip them around their ankles, so they can be dragged through the tunnel. Silt swirls. Frank removes his REBREATHER and holds it in front of him The others nervously do the same. Frank signals for Josh ‘buddy up’ with him. Pushing his REBREATHER ahead of him, Frank disappears into the hole. After a few seconds, Josh follows. INT. BODY TUBE - DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. POV Josh: He follows Frank into the tunnel, keeping his h on the line at all times. Frank's pack and fins can just seen scraping along the tunnel ahead. Breathe. Push. Brea Push.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Stay green. Please stay green. Don’t beep. Please. Don't fucking beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the entrance, Carl disappears into the tunnel. Cr George turns toward Victoria and taps her on the shoulder She jumps. George shows her a message on his WRIST SLATE: "YOU CAN DO IT", next to a SMILEY FACE. Victoria nods her head, grateful. Crazy George squeezes her hand reassuring Then he disappears into the tunnel. INT. BODY TUBE - DEVIL'S RESTRICTION. A nightmarish sequence as the divers crawl down the body in near-zero visibilty: Frank glances behind him. The dull orange glow of Josh's light approaches. They exchange ‘okay’ signals. 57 Further back in the tunnel, Carl wedges stuck. He tries turn around but can't move. His BREATHING skyrockets. Car braces himself and STRAINS against the ceiling. White fragments of rock break free and dance like snowflakes against his helmet. He eventually manages to pull himself forward. Crazy George freezes as the ceiling starts to CREAK and GROAN. He glances back and sees Victoria waiting patientl for him. They exchange ‘okay’ signals. After a few second George continues, his eyes glued nervously to the ceiling Victoria claws her way forward, following Crazy George's EQUIPMENT BAG. Her eyes are fixed with dogged determinati She’s HUMMING a tune: “ONWARD CHRISTIAN SOLDIERS”, to cal herself down. INT. UNEXPLORED ABYSS. Darkness. Then the hazy glow of approaching lights. A thi cloud of silt billows from the tunnel in the cliff wall. free-fall parachutists emerging from a cloud, the divers break through into the gin-clear waters of the abyss. Victoria finally appears, a victorious grin on her face. Crazy George swims over, shakes her hand and then helps h back into the REBREATHER. Frank shows Josh his VR3 DIVE

dialogues.speaker: DEPTH 102M. TOTAL DECO
dialogues.text: Josh nods his understanding. Frank flashes everyone the ‘ signal. VARIOUS SHOTS as the team slowly work their way up the ca walls, decompressing every few feet. Frank swims over to check on the others periodically. The TOTAL DECO TIME slowly ticks down on their DIVE COMPUTERS Crazy George hovers next to Victoria, adjusting her buoya as required. Victoria is SHIVERING from the cold. George her hands, trying to warm her up. Carl swims away from the others, far out into the abyss. busy exploring the far side of the cave. Frank signals for Josh to ascend to the next deco stop. H eyes narrow in concern when he sees Josh isn’t moving. He swims over and catches him playing the 'OCTOPUS' video ga on his VR3 DIVE COMPUTER. Frank MUMBLES angrily into his MOUTHPIECE and signals “up”. 58  Finally, Crazy George flashes his beam to get everyone's attention: the team visibly relax as their lights reflect the surface, far above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS REACTION SHOTS as the team surface. They remove their MOUTHPIECES and gratefully suck down gr gulps of air. Then they gaze around them in wonder. The cavern is huge: an endless dessert of sand dunes rising f the water and disappearing into the darkness. A sunless Sahara, with no sign of the walls or ceiling. Crazy George throws back his head and emits a WHOOP of delight. His voice ECHOES into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness. Josh wakes with a start and stares up at the c ceiling. It takes him a moment to remember where he is. Frank is busy changing the batteries in the FLASHLIGHTS. George is filling a DRIED FOOD PACK with water. Carl is s alone on a rock, staring out into space. Victoria lies SHIVERING inside her SPACE BLANKET: she’s hypothermic and utterly miserable. GEORGE offers her some food. Josh crawls toward the EQUIPMENT BAGS and starts rummagin through the SUPPLIES. He pulls out a food bag and walks d to the water. Frank crouches by the shoreline, his flashl fixed upon a submerged rock far out in the water. He’s watching, listening, feeling the cave.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How are the supplies looking? Josh is still angry. He ignores his father.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (ANGRY)
dialogues.text: I said...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: There's food for a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This place will be underwater in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (DERISIVELY)
dialogues.text: How do you know? 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that rock? Last night it was above water. Frank marches over to the EQUIPMENT BAG and pulls out sev items: A ROPE, COMPASS and VERTICAL GEAR. Carl shuffles o

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: How long before they come and get us?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: The rescue party. Frank smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There's no rescues down here, mate. Only body recoveries.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: But when word gets out I'm missing...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Then what? No amount of money is gonna save you now. Folk up there already think you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (DEADPAN)
dialogues.text: Reckon I should of sold my Delvenet shares. Frank smiles as he shoulders the rope.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (FUMING)
dialogues.text: I just want to know what the plan is.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No plan ever survived contact with the enemy. And this cave just shat out every plan I had.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SHOUTING)
dialogues.text: Then what, pray tell, do you suggest we do!?! Frank marches over to him. 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could try calling your lawyers, so they can sue me. Oh, no. I forgot... Frank lowers his voice to an angry whisper

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Some fucker switched the comms off! Carl goes white as a sheet as Frank storms off.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: Stay here. I’m going to scout ahead. Carl shouts after him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CALLING AFTER HIM)
dialogues.text: I still think we should sit tight and wait a few days!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (OVER HIS SHOULDER)
dialogues.text: For what? The lights to go out? Batteries won't last forever. Carl considers this. Then reaches up and switches his HEL LIGHT off.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Fucker. Josh watches his father's light disappear into the distan After a few moments, he decides to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expanse of sand dunes stretch along the banks of an underground lake. Frank follows the shoreline, flashing h light around the cave. Josh follows, keeping out of sight Frank pauses to take a compass reading. Josh ducks as Fra light swings toward him. When Josh looks up, Frank is gon Josh considers following. Then gazes nervously around him

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fuck it. He stumbles back the way he came. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the sump, Victoria is still SHIVERING uncontrolla A single light casts gloomy shadows across the walls.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (TO VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (SHIVERING)
dialogues.text: I-I still can't feel my feet. Crazy George lifts the space blanket and pulls off Victor soaked WETSUIT BOOTEES.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: They're like blocks of ice. Crazy George starts rubbing Victoria's feet and legs. Car casts a glance but decides to say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: T-Thank you, George.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ain't nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I mean back there. The way you h-helped me. It was...was... Victoria stops herself before she gets upset.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TO GEORGE)
dialogues.text: Pity our illustrious leader doesn't share your humanity.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Frank’s got Josh to think about now.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: That man only thinks about himself. He'd leave us all to die if he had to.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don't go sayin' that. (trying to convince himself) Frank's gonna get us out of here. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, George. Wake up. You saw what he did to Luko. What makes you think he values our lives any differently?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: He just lives by a different set of rules, that’s all. He did what needed to be done. None of us had the stomach for it.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Precisely. And that's what makes us human beings.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (ANGRY)
dialogues.text: Spare us the morality lessons, Carl. You have no right to judge anyone, least of all Frank. It was a mercy killing.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yeah? Let's see if the authorities agree when we get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You can be such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're taking his side in this!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (BITTER)
dialogues.text: He's not the one who got us into this mess!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You know damn well.

dialogues.speaker: SUNLESS SAHARA
dialogues.text: Josh scrambles BREATHLESSLY to the top of a boulder pile. looks confused and scared when his light fails to reveal others waiting on the other side. Instead, a vast GAPING TUNNEL leads further into the cave. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! (beat) Keep going, you ain’t lost.(beat) They have to be through there... Josh stumbles on, deeper into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria pulls herself to her feet and staggers towards C

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You turned off the comm system. (beat) Didn’t you? Crazy George looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Why the hell would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (EXPLODING)
dialogues.text: “Uncontactable until further notice!” Well, we're pretty un- fucking-contactable now!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You're delusional!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Delusional? Look where we fucking are! You may have just killed us all. A voice from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It don't matter now. Frank steps out of the darkness. He's overheard everythin

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) None of it. What matters now is survival.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You're enjoying this aren't you? Making life or death decisions. Playing God. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no God down here, mate. This cave doesn't give a flying fuck about you, me, or Christ-all- mighty. We're specks of dust to her, passing through.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What the hell was I thinking: letting you talk me into this? You're a fucking animal. Even your son can't stand the sight of you. Frank glances around.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where is Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh reaches the top of another dune. A vast expanse of nothingness lays before him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Give them a shout, they’re bound to hear you.(beat) You'd never hear the last of it. (beat) Admit it: you're lost. (beat) Alright, retrace your steps... Josh turns and flashes his light back the way he’s come. Three identical-looking tunnels lead into the rockface be him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank and George are following Josh's footprints. They en abruptly at the edge of a shingle collapse.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! Josh! His voice ECHOES eerily around the walls of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Quit freakin’ out. He’ll be fine. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, George! You were supposed to watch him!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: The boy wanted to go off exploring. (grinning) Remind you of anyone? Frank scowls and storms away. Crazy George smiles as he watches him disappear into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (IN PAIN)
dialogues.text: Gnnnt George suddenly winces in pain. He lifts his arm and flex it, a concerned look on his face. CuT TO: Josh is about to enter the largest tunnel when...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (DISTANT 0.S.)
dialogues.text: Josh! He freezes as he hears Frank’s voice. But he can’t tell w direction it’s coming from.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m through here! A few seconds of silence.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CLOSER 0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t move! Keep talking!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (SLOWLY CIRCLING)
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? (beat) I think I’ve found the way forward! (beat) I was just coming to tell you... BLAM! A hand shoots out of the dark and grabs Josh by the shoulder. Frank spins him around and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to stay with the group?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get lost down here and it’s all over. Don't ever wander off again! Understand? Josh bristles in anger and SLAPS Frank’s hand away.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Get off me! Josh's voice ECHOES into the far distance. Frank’s head s up: it sounds like the cave goes on forever. Crazy George steps out of the shadows, still flexing his wrist. He gri through the pain and slaps Josh on the back.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shoot, I reckon the boy's done found the way forward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast chamber, larger than several football fields. No s of the walls or ceiling. Three specks of light appear in distance. Two more lights trail behind them. Josh plods along next to Crazy George. They both struggle under the weight of their REBREATHERS and also carry a he EQUIPMENT BAG between them. Crazy George keeps flexing hi hand every few seconds, a worried expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Asshole. He's a fucking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hell, he's just tryin’ to look out for you. Easy enough to get lost in a place like this.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nothing's ever good enough. I remember writing a school project for him once. A cave diving adventure. He hands it back to me with a list of technical notes...

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (A KNOWING SMILE)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Frank sure likes to give a lotta notes...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was seven years old, George! 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear about the time Frank really fucked up? Josh tries to conceal his interest.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Couple of years ago, he’s in the outback, checking out this massive hole, name of... Crazy George grinds to a halt, confused and then a little scared as he struggles to remember the name.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Damn, what was that place called? He drops the EQUIPMENT BAG and leans, exhausted, against large rock. Josh looks at him, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SHAKING HIS HEAD)
dialogues.text: Anyhow, he backs his truck right up to the water, so he can tie off his line. Then he does his dive. Crazy George takes a long pull of water from his flask.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: On the way back out, he sees the entrance is blocked by a vehicle, sixty feet underwater. And he's like: "Shit, that licence plate looks familiar". (beat) He'd only gone and left the handbrake off! Josh smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Had to smash open his back window, just so he could swim out! Josh LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (CHUCKLING)
dialogues.text: And then he has to haul his sorry ass back over 60 miles of desert! (beat) He's a hell of a guy, your old man. Once you get to know him. Josh considers this. 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Take the bag will ya? Go on, I'll catch up directly. Crazy George waits until Josh has gone, then starts scribbling numbers onto his WRIST SLATE. His hand is SHAK uncontrollably as he writes: 101-7= Crazy George struggles to do the math. After a few second he realizes he can’t work out the answer.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SCARED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Ah, shit... He opens the MOUTHPIECE on his REBREATHER and flushes the loop with the button marked OXYGEN. Breathing from the REBREATHER, he staggers after Josh’s light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football Field chamber ends in a huge mountain of rubble disappears into the higher reaches of the cave. Victoria collapses, SHIVERING on a rock. She watches Carl’s light ascending up the debris slope, far above her.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (ANNOYED)
dialogues.text: Carl! Wait for me! A voice in the darkness startles her. Frank steps out of shadows.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (SHIVERING)
dialogues.text: Hot bath and a brandy and I'd be fine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We’1l camp here. Frank nods toward Carl’s distant light.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm guessing this is a little more adventurous than his usual excursions?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Next year we're sticking to Disneyland. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you ever wind up with a guy like that?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I ask myself that question every day. (beat) I was one of his guides on Everest. (smiling) Bastard had me fired so I’d come and work for him. How about you? How’d you get involved with the dot-com devil?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Usual sponsors would have turned this into a circus. Twenty guys, all with different agendas. I've dealt with enough of those fucksticks to last a lifetime. Rocks CLATTER down the slope as Carl reaches the top.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I figured your boy up there was the best way to get some real exploration done. (beat) This wasn’t quite what I had in mind. Victoria smiles as she gazes into Frank's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Well. I’m glad you’re here to look after us.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don’t go fooling yourself. Down here, you’re on your own. A voice from the darkness above them.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Victoria! You have to see this. It's incredible! Victoria shakes her head sadly and starts climbing the boulder pile. EXT. TOP OF BOULDER PILE. Carl stands on top of the highest boulder. The team stagg up the final few yards to join him. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to 'Carl's Cavern’. Frank and Crazy George exchange a withering look. FLASH! Carl’s powerful CAMERA STROBE reveals the vastness of the chamber they have just walked through. The walls and ceil are covered in millions of delicate white straws.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CLICKING PHOTOS)
dialogues.text: Hey, Josh! Get up here. We’ll make the cover of ‘National Geographic' yet!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: National Lampoon, more like. Josh scrambles up to the highest boulder and poses for Ca Frank storms over and snatches the camera off Carl. He hu it far over the edge of the boulder slope. After a few seconds, we hear it SMASH apart below. A moment of tension as Carl and Frank face each other. Suddenly, Carl launches himself at Frank. George stumbles between them.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Whoa! Let's calm it down!

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SCREAMING)
dialogues.text: You fucking asshole! You fuck, fuck, fucking asshole!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would you do that? What gives you the fucking right to do that? To me? Frank pushes past George and grabs Carl by the throat, SLAMMING him against the boulder.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You listen to me! When they pull our bodies outta here, they ain't finding no Goddamn tourist shots. Not of me and not of my son, grinning like an idiot! Understand?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Frank. You're choking him.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Frank, please. Let him go. Frank releases Carl. Carl slumps to the floor, clutching throat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They’1l1 find us with our tanks empty and our fingers scraped to the bone. Frank turns to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) They ain't handing your mother a Goddamn photograph. Frank storms away, back down the boulder slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on Frank: looking grim as he fits the last set of BATTERIES into the flashlights. He shoulders his pack and starts KICKING everyone awake.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: C’mon. Let’s move. Various GROANS as everyone rolls over in their SPACE BLAN in a vain attempt to go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (ROARING)
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS: Frank leads the team along a series of nar tunnels, winding ever upwards. Several smaller tunnels br off. Frank ignores them and continues moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel ends abruptly at the edge of a sheer drop. No forward. The team collapse to the floor, utterly exhauste Frank crouches at the edge of the precipice and launches rock. 72  After six seconds, we hear a distant SPLOSH!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Maybe we missed something? We could always go back...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We ain't going back. Frank tosses the rope down into the drop and secures it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: I want you to start ferrying the others down as quickly as possible...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (SHIVERING)
dialogues.text: I-I’'ll try. I’m just not sure I c- can hold a r-ope anymore...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’1l do it. Give it to me. Frank casts a quick glance at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No! Josh sags and slouches away. Frank calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I need a good rope man below. Josh swells slightly at this veiled compliment and starts eagerly prepping his vertical gear. Victoria flashes an approving smile at Frank. Frank shrugs as if to say “yeah yeah”. Carl ambles over to Crazy George, who is resting further the tunnel, breathing oxygen from his REBREATHER. He quic conceals his SHAKING ARM as Carl approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONCERNED)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. Just catchin’ my breath.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (WHISPERING)
dialogues.text: Why the fuck is ‘Captain Caveman’ taking us deeper? Makes no sense at all. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he’s following the river.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: All the way to the ocean?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: If that’s what it takes. Crazy George goes back onto OXYGEN. Carl calls over to Fr

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We've been climbing for six hours now! Surely we must be close to the surface?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (STUDYING THE ROCK)
dialogues.text: I reckon we are about...thirty feet from the surface. Carl gazes up in astonishment. And hope.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: But unless you brought some dynamite, that ain’t gonna help us much.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We could at least split up and search those passageways we passed?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They’re too small. We go back down. And hope the lower cave ain’t flooded yet.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I say we vote on it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: You wanna wake up and have a word with yourself. This ain’t no democracy. Frank steps off the edge of the drop and rappels down int the darkness. Josh clips himself onto the rope.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Josh. Help me search those tunnels. Josh deliberates. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do everything he says, Josh. You and I can find our own way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Josh! Get down here! Josh glances down at his father’s light far below. He shr and casts Carl an apologetic look. Josh disappears over t cliff. Carl glowers after him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (ANNOYED)
dialogues.text: Idiots. Carl shoulders his pack.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TO VICTORIA)
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let’s go. Victoria glares up at him, shivering and miserable. She slowly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I-I’m staying with them, Carl. TIGHT on Carl: an angry and betrayed look upon his face a struggles to deal with this rejection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands waist deep in an underground lake, holding o the bottom of the rope. He gazes up at Josh's light far a him. ZIIIIIIP! Josh zooms down the rope and breaks hard, bouncing to a halt only inches above Frank's head. Frank shoots him a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Quit showin’ off. Wait here and help the others. I’1l scout on ahead. Frank shoulders his EQUIPMENT BAG and wades out into the water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (DISAPPOINTED)
dialogues.text: When do I get to scout?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Soon as you stop getting lost. 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy George is rappeling down a particularly steep part the shaft. His REBREATHER dangles several feet below him, acting like a pendulum. His face is screwed up in pain as edges his way down the sheer cliff wall.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Gnnnng! His body suddenly spasms, his fist clamping up into a tig balled fist.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SCARED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. Not now. Please not now... A SHOUT from above causes him to look up. Victoria peers at him, a concerned look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I-I'm fine! Momentarily distracted, he doesn't notice his LONG HAIR slipping into the FIVE-BAR RACK. George pushes himself we off the wall. ZIIIP! He plunges several feet down the rop his hand too weak to operate the brake. His hair gets YAN VIOLENTLY into the rack, almost scalping him. In extreme pain, he grits his teeth and remains silent, reluctant to the others know he is in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (ANNOYED, TO HIMSELF)
dialogues.text: That’s just great, George. Call the fucking rope police. He swings himself painfully toward a rocky ledge. Tries t transfer his body weight. Success! A SIGH of relief. Reac toward his DIVE KNIFE, he carefully starts sawing away at trapped hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh spots something floating on the surface of the water Fishing it out, he realizes it is a clump of HAIR. Curiou he flashes his light up the shaft. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy George has almost freed himself from the tangle. As goes to cut the final strand of hair...CRACK! The rock le supporting him suddenly crumbles. SHNICK! His knife SLICES clean through the descent rope. Crazy George starts to fall, his hands scrambling to find purchase, his fingernails SCRAPING the rock until...

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Unnnng! His fingers wedge into a ledge. He clings precariously to edge of a 300ft drop, his legs and REBREATHER dangling ab the void.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit shit shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh gazes up in horror as the rope coils into the water around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria feels the rope go slack. She shouts down the dro

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: off rope?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Crazy George shakes his head at the irony.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: No shit, I'm off rope! A SHOUT from below.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rig another drop line! Now!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 77 Victoria leans over the edge and sees Crazy George cling to the ledge far below. The severed rope hangs several fe above his head. No way he can reach it.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (TO CARL)
dialogues.text: Fetch the rope! Quickly! Carl scrambles toward the EQUIPMENT PACK. As he tears thr it, a dreadful realization hits him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Frank has the rope bag!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Crazy George’s hand SHAKES uncontrollably as he tries to himself back up. It's impossible. He peers down and sees Josh’s light far below him. He closes his eyes in terror mumbles a quiet PRAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh yells out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad! No reply. Josh’s eyes narrow in fierce determination. He steels himself, grabs the end of the severed rope and tie to his harness.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hold on! I'm coming up!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! Josh! Stay where you are! Josh starts to free-climb the sheer walls of the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: In a last desperate effort, Crazy George swings his legs toward a narrow crevice. Transferring his body weight, he manages to unclip the carabiner supporting his REBREATHER falls away into the darkness below.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh navigates his way up a vertical crack in the rock, h feet slipping on the treacherous walls of the shaft. He l precariously toward a handhold just out of his reach... 78 SMACK! The rebreather smashes into him, spinning him off wall. Josh starts to fall. Lightning reflexes as Josh man to grab a narrow ledge. The rebreather SMASHES apart on t rocks below. Josh spots a ledge on the opposite side of t shaft and LEAPS toward it, just managing to cling on.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (GASPING)
dialogues.text: This is tough enough without you throwing things at me! A voice from below.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! There's a ledge to your left! Josh gazes down at his father's light far below him. Then starts to climb.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Victoria and Carl can see Josh edging his way up the wall toward Crazy George.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: He's nearly there! Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Crazy George's grip is finally about to give way.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I-I can't hold on!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Two more seconds, while I rebelay! Crazy George peers down and sees Josh HAMMERING a BOLT in the smooth cliff wall several feet below him.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'm slipping!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! Josh is right beneath you!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Below! Josh lets the hammer fall into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 79  Frank leaps to one side as the hammer SPLASHES into the water. He gazes up at Josh, flinching with every movement boy makes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh CLIPS his COW'S TAIL into the BOLT, then reaches out toward Crazy George. Crazy George swings tantalizingly ou his reach. Adjusting his footing, he leans out further.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (continuing) I-I've...got you! Josh grabs Crazy George's harness. Just as George’s grip gives way.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ahhbhh! Crazy George tumbles away into the darkness, taking Josh him. Josh keeps a firm grip on George’s harness and after few feet...TWANG! His COW'S TAIL snaps taut, SLAMMING the both violently against the walls of the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Gnnn! Crazy George spins inverted, Josh clutching his harness. looks up at him, clearly terrified.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Pass your safety! Crazy George’s hand shakes as he reaches below him and gr his cow's TAIL.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now pull yourself back up! Quickly! Crazy George slowly inches the rope toward Josh's outstretched fingers. Josh finally grabs his carabiner and...CLICK! Snaps him into his own harness. With a GRUNT of relief, Josh releases his grip. They both swing free, hanging suspended in mid air. BREATHLESS and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SMILING GRATEFULLY)
dialogues.text: And I thought they called me crazy! 80 Josh threads the severed rope into the bolt and rappels with George dangling below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is performing a full NEUROLOGICAL EXAM on Crazy Geo who is breathing oxygen from Frank’s REBREATHER. His own REBREATHER lays smashed on the rocks around him. Crazy Ge is having trouble focussing on Frank’s finger as he waves in front of his face. Josh watches from a few feet away, supervising the rope as the others rappel down.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO JOSH)
dialogues.text: See how his left eye is tracking much slower than the right? Josh nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Helium bubble. Wedged in his spine. (to George) You’ve bent yourself good and proper this time. Crazy George takes the MOUTHPIECE out and pats the OXYGEN CYLINDER in the REBREATHER.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ah, quit worrying. Couple more hours of this shit and I'll be right as rain. (beat) Just remind me not to smoke.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (SMILING)
dialogues.text: Soon as we find some deep water, we’ll recompress you.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: (beat) That was a hell of a thing your boy just did, Frank. Frank walks over to Josh and places a hand on his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was. Josh can’t believe it. A compliment? From Frank? Frank shoulders one of the REBREATHERS and wades out into the darkness. He pauses below the drop and gazes up. 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course, I‘d have stuck to the left- hand side of the shaft. Much better hand-holds. Josh and Crazy George exchange a look. Josh rolls his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deafening ROAR of a waterfall can be heard close by. Frank and Josh are busy rigging the easiest route downstr Josh looks back to see Crazy George staggering through th waist-deep water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONCERNED)
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen if he can’t walk any more?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (DEADLY SERIOUS)
dialogues.text: I’1l have to kill him. Josh looks shocked. Then realizes Frank is joking. Frank casts an admiring glance back toward Crazy George. Badly injured, yet still helping Victoria navigate the river.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (laughing) We’1ll stick the poor bugger on oxygen at 10 meters. He'll be right as rain. They walk on for a few paces.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You think we could do something safer next year? Like climb the North face of the Eiger?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (GRINNING)
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. I reckon I owe you that. (beat) No ropes though? Josh walks on. Frank watches him for a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I haven’t been the greatest father, Josh. I realize that. Josh stops in his tracks. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I just got too hooked into all of this. Josh turns and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: But it was never really about exploration. This place is my church. Frank gazes reverently around the cave.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: My sanctum. The only place I get to hold a mirror to my soul. (beat) I do this because I have to.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (BITTER)
dialogues.text: Yeah? (beat) Must be real nice for you. Josh walks off. Frank sags visibly as he is overcome with enormous sense of guilt and loss. He reaches out and grab the cold cave walls for support. Then gazes sadly after h son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river suddenly disappears over a series of three waterfalls. A steep cliff borders the edge of the falls: easy way down. A thick MIST fills the air. Frank has to S to be heard above the ROAR of water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Reckon you can find the way down?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Piece of piss! Frank flashes him a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (WEARILY)
dialogues.text: I'll be careful.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We'll rig the zip line! Frank wades back over to the shallows at the edge of the falls and pulls a 50 METER ROPE out of the equipment bag. 83  Victoria sits on a rock a few feet away, SHIVERING uncontrollably. She's helping Crazy George keep his MOUTHPIECE in place. Frank's eyes register concern: Crazy George's condition h worsened considerably. He’s turning blue and his facial muscles now droop like a stroke victim.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) How you doing, tough guy? George weakly flashes him an "okay" signal.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (POINTING)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Looks like there’s a deep pool below the falls. Hang in there. Won’t be long now.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: On the far side of the river, Josh navigates his way down treacherous rocks lining the falls. It's a torturous desc

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank and Carl brace themselves against the flow and wade toward a rocky island that sits midstream above the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Pass the cams! Frank slips a large CAM into a crack in the ceiling while Carl prepares the drop rope. cur TO: Josh arrives at the pool below the last waterfall: it’s d and crystal clear. Josh quickly fixes a CAM into the wall flashes his light up toward Frank.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank receives the signal and throws the rope far over th falls. Josh grabs the rope as it floats past him. He secu it to the CAM and ties it off. cuT TO: Carl and Frank HEAVE on the rope. The rope tightens, form a ZIP LINE above the three waterfalls. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it! Start sending the equipment down! Frank clips the REBREATHERS and EQUIPMENT BAGS to the rop The first REBREATHER is launched over the waterfall and Z down the line, SPLASHING into the plunge pool beside Josh Another REBREATHER zooms down the line seconds later. The EQUIPMENT BAGS soon follow.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: George! You’re next! Victoria helps Crazy George to his feet. They stagger forward. POV Crazy George: as he wades through the water toward Fr his world starts to SPIN. Vertigo assaults his senses. He lurches toward the edge of the falls.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Frank...I... His world continues to kaleidoscope until...SPLASH! Crazy George faceplants the water and is washed toward the edge the falls. Victoria is dragged into the water with him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (POINTING)
dialogues.text: Frank! Frank leaps into the water. As Crazy George sweeps by, Fr grabs him and heaves him toward a BOULDER midstream. Craz George clings weakly to the boulder as Frank flashes his light around, looking for Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Over there! Victoria is clinging to a rock at the edge of the falls, buffeted by the cascade of water. Frank wades out toward bracing himself against the ferocious flow. He manages to grab her SAFETY ROPE, just as her grip gives way. Victoria disappears over the edge of the falls. She hangs inverted from her harness, engulfed by the torrent of wat that pounds her against the rock. Frank struggles to keep hold of her safety rope. Curt TO: 85  At the bottom of the falls, Josh is about to unclip the REBREATHERS from the rope when he hears Victoria SCREAM. races back up the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank is slowly being dragged over the edge of the falls, hands and feet scrambling to find purchase. Carl releases ZIP LINE and staggers over to help them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (TO CARL)
dialogues.text: No! Stay on the rope! Carl turns back but it’s too late. TWANG! The ZIP LINE whiplashes through the ANCHOR BOLT and disappears downstr

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh is climbing the waterfall below Victoria when he see the ZIP LINE suddenly go limp. A glance downstream confir his worst fear: the two REBREATHERS clipped to the end of rope are being washed away. A shout from above.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Josh! Grab the rope! We’re losing the equipment! Josh spots the rope in the pool below him. It’s slowly be washed downstream. Josh glances up at Victoria, still han inverted fifty feet above him. He deliberates: does he he Victoria or save the equipment? Josh makes his decision. He continues to climb up toward Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank CURSES in despair as both REBREATHERS disappear downstream.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Josh! Goddamn it! cut TO: POV Victoria: Through the savage jets of water, she can s Josh’s light approaching from below. She manages to pull head out of the ferocious flow and into an airspace behin the waterfall. Gasping for breath, she calls down to Josh

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (HALF DROWNING)
dialogues.text: Josh..! No!...! 86 Josh draws level with Victoria. He edges his way toward clinging perilously to a narrow ledge behind the falls. W pounds his body. His foot slips and he only just manages save himself. Josh glances down fearfully at the rocks, f feet below him. Victoria pulls her head back up toward Frank, COUGHING an SPLUTTERING as the water pounds her face.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (PLEADING)
dialogues.text: Frank! Let me go! Frank gazes down at Victoria, a cold look on his face. Ca grip tightens on the rope.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No! We have to save her! Victoria SCREAMS at the top of her lungs as she sees Josh light edging it’s way toward her. Frank spots it too.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: Y...got to....et me go, Frank! You’ll...lose us both! TIGHT on Frank as he coldly accepts her decision.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Victoria swings her head back into the airspace behind th falls. Josh has reached the point of no return. He’s reac precariously toward Victoria. Eye contact is made.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: G-Give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank releases the rope. It is violently ripped from Carl hands and disappears over the falls.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh is left staring at the space where Victoria used to

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nooocoooce!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Victoria plunges 50 feet into the 'washing machine', a ROARING cascade below the falls. Buffeted from all sides, is unceremoniously spat over the second waterfall. 87 BLAM! She hits the water hard and is immediately dragged by the cascade of water. CRACK! Her head dashes against a rock below the surface. Blood clouds the water. BADOOSH! Victoria is thrown over the second waterfall and dragged below again. Beneath the water, Victoria struggles weakly toward the surface but cannot move. Looking down, she sees her SAFET ROPE has jammed between two rocks, trapping her underwate A wave of euphoria washes over her as her hypoxic brain starts to shut down. Victoria desperately tugs on the rop weaker and weaker until... BLIP! A final cloud of bubbles exhaled.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh is slipping and sliding his way back down the rocks toward the bottom of the falls.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Victoria! Victoria! He reaches the final 30ft drop. His flashlight reflects o Victoria's body beneath the surface. There is no quick wa down. SPLOOSH! Josh leaps off the cliff into the pool below. Hi light flicks through the water to reveal Victoria’s lifel body floating a few feet away. She is suspended in mid-water, hanging by her safety rope Josh tries to swim toward him but the current is too stro He claws his way across the bottom, RAGING in anger and frustration. With a CRY of despair, Josh is forced to release himself. He floats back to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: A DREAM-LIKE SEQUENCE as the team react to Victoria’s dea Carl is hysterical. Sobbing uncontrollably. Punching the water in anger and frustration and CURSING Frank. Crazy George looks utterly defeated. He crawls weakly to edge of the river and collapses next to Frank. Frank gazes down at Josh from the top of the falls. 88 Josh drags himself out of the water and clings to a rock GASPING for breath. He stares up at his father. A murdero hatred in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS as the team stumble their way downstream, following the raging river. Frank leads the way. A grim look on his face as he naviga the best way downstream. He is wearing the last remaining REBREATHER. Carl flashes his light back toward Crazy George and Josh. considers returning to help them, but is too exhausted. H staggers downstream past Frank, his face set in stone. Crazy George is in a bad way. Josh has to support him as stumbles across the rocks. Frank waits for them. Frank helps drag Crazy George across a set of rapids. He reaches back to offer Josh a helping hand. Josh refuses. moment of tension as they confront each other. Josh pushe past him, into the darkness. Four lights, continuing steadily downstream until finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel ends abruptly at another sump: a shallow pool where the river disappears beneath a cliff. A small entra beneath the surface marks the continuation of the underwa cave. The team wearily pull themselves out of the water a crawl up the muddy shoreline. Everyone is physically and emotionally exhausted. A depre silence engulfs the group. Josh gently eases Crazy George the floor. Crazy George curls himself up in a ball, fever and MOANING in pain. Josh lifts his head clear of the mud

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (ANGRY TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: He can’t go any further. He needs oxygen, Goddamn it! Frank lifts the REBREATHER off his back and shoots Josh a accusing look. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you. This is all we have left. Now.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (BRISTLING)
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beat) It means, we need it to get out. Frank flashes his light around. A dry tunnel leads upward

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Up there. We’ll be safe up there.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: From what? A nuclear fucking attack?

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (EXCITED)
dialogues.text: Over here! Frank staggers forward. Carl's light has revealed several FOOTPRINTS in the entrance to the tunnel. Carl begins to with relief and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Footprints! This must be the way out!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: A-Are you sure? Carl races back and starts shaking Josh.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We're getting out of here! You hear? We’re gonna live! Carl staggers drunkenly back up into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Oh thank-you. Thank-you Jesus thank- you, thank-you, thank-you... Frank continues to examine the footprints, a grim look on face.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (TO FRANK)
dialogues.text: You look disappointed. Pissed off someone beat you to it? 90  Frank glares at Josh. Then turns his attention to Crazy George.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Help me get him somewhere dry. Frank hauls Crazy George to his feet. He gazes at Frank i half-conscious daze.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: S-Sorry to be such a b-burden, Frank. Frank smiles sadly at his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Josh drag Crazy George up the narrow tunnel. Th river has become a DISTANT ROAR below them. They stagger of the tunnel and emerge inside a tall, dry, chimney-like room. Carl is kneeling in the center of the Chimney. Josh stagg forward, flashing his light around the walls.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. There’s no way out.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: How can you be sure? Carl directs the beam of his light toward the back of the cave. Josh reels in horror: The skeletal remains of TWO DIVERS on the floor, their bones held together by their WETSUITS The bodies are arranged to suggest a violent struggle too place. DRIED BLOOD stains the wall and floor. One of the diver’s skulls has been SMASHED apart by the others STAGE CYLINDER.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (HORRIFIED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: The missing divers.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (RESIGNED)
dialogues.text: We’re all going to fucking die. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is on the far side of the cavern, busy checking ove the remaining REBREATHER. His FLASHLIGHT casts ghostly shadows over the cavern walls. Crazy George lays in Josh's arms, MOANING in a feverish sleep. Carl glances down at his cracked TAG HEUER DIVE WA Broken now.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why’d you keep looking at that?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I’m wondering when it stopped.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It's been four days now. It'll just be getting dark outside.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I should be flying home right now. Josh and Carl hear the faint wisps of COLERIDGE echoing around the cave.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (URGENT WHISPER)
dialogues.text: He's out of his mind, Josh. Just listen to him. We should have checked out those tunnels. We could have been out of here by now, instead of being forced on some suicide mission...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He’s convinced there’s dry cave on the other side of the sump.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (SNEERING)
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well buddy-breathing through, two at a time is insane.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You got a better plan? (beat) We can make it. If it’s not too far...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S. WHISPERED)
dialogues.text: In Xanadu...did Kubla Khan...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S. WHISPERED)
dialogues.text: A stately pleasure dome decree...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where Alph the scared river, ran...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S. WHISPERED)
dialogues.text: Down to a sunless sea. 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if there is no air pocket, Josh? What then? Josh glances toward the macabre SKELETONS. And shudders. TIGHT on Carl: he can't take his eyes off the remaining REBREATHER. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sleeps, tucked inside a rocky crevasse. He looks li he’s part of the cave walls. Josh shakes him awake, a concerned look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Josh stand by the water. The last REBREATHER is missing. No sign of Carl.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe he's scouting ahead? Frank flashes him a look.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: The tunnel could choke? Then he’d have to head back.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Either way, we lose.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Frank gazes around the cave. Then marches back up to Chim

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We find another way out. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits in a depressed trance, CLICKING his fading FLASHLIGHT on and off repeatedly as he stares at the SKEL REMAINS of the two divers. Josh watches him from a distance as he tends to Crazy Geo Crazy George’s condition has worsened overnight. He lays Josh's arms, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (DELIRIOUS)
dialogues.text: F-Frank?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It's Josh. Crazy George suddenly starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: I-I can’t move my legs anymore. Josh says nothing. He glances over at his father.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Frank's eyes narrow as he notices something unu about the SKELETONS. Scrambling like a crab, he clambers the rocks to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh scrutinizes Frank's unusual behavior from a distance

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SCARED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: L-Luko was here. Last night. I reckon he came for me, Josh...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Don’t talk like that. Try and rest. Crazy George suddenly grabs Josh.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t let them...come for me, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (TERRIFIED)
dialogues.text: Them... 94  Crazy George points into the dark. Macabre shadows dance across the walls. Sinister shapes Josh's imagination pref to ignore. Josh shudders.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nothing’s going to hurt you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Crouching down, Frank examines a curious DARK STAIN on on the SKULLS. His fingers come away dirty. He SNIFFS his fingers and casts his beam toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Crazy George lapses into unconsciousness. Josh checks to he is still breathing, struggling to fight back his tears Suddenly, Frank looms over him, a manic look on his face. throws the SKULL down into Josh’s lap. Josh jumps.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INTENSE)
dialogues.text: A Samurai prepares himself each day for his own death. That’s what makes him invincible. Josh gazes up at him, a worried expression on his face. F suddenly grins at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: c'mon. We're getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: H-How?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We'll float up through the ceiling. Josh suddenly looks scared. His father is clearly insane. Frank wipes the DARK STAIN off the skull with his finger waves it in front of Josh's face. Josh wrinkles his nose.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (DISGUSTED)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Bat guano. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Frank and Josh focus their beams high on the ceiling of CHIMNEY. 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying there’s a tunnel up there?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: We lost all the vertical gear. How are we going to climb up? Frank hands Josh a large BOULDER from the floor of the ca Then grabs one for himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We don’t climb. We float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Josh carry the boulders down toward the sump. BADOOSH! Frank heaves his boulder into the water and watc it sink toward the entrance of the underwater tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You're going to dam the river?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We'll flood the cavern. The water will carry us right up to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: That‘ll take forever! Frank is already on his way back up to Chimney.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You got something better to do? SPLOSH! Josh throws his rock into the water and reluctant trudges after his father.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS as Frank and Josh carry rock after rock dow toward the river. It's backbreaking work. Josh seems determined to select bigger rocks than Frank. WETSUITS are removed as the sweat starts to pour down the bodies. 96  Josh crawls over to check Crazy George’s condition. Frank collapses at the edge of the sump and starts GULPIN down the muddy water like a parched beast. Josh gazes dow him in revulsion. Frank gazes guiltily at Crazy George as he staggers past but he’s too focussed on the task at hand to stop. Frank and Josh are soon caked in mud. They look like prim beings, barely human. Josh starts GULPING down the muddy water along with his father. The pile of rocks continues to grown until... SPLOSH! Josh tosses the last rock in place and collapses the mud next to Frank. A massive pile of boulders now sea the underwater cave.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (GRIM SATISFACTION)
dialogues.text: It’s working. Frank shines his fading beam toward the shoreline. The wa is already creeping up toward them. Josh rolls over onto back and WHOOPS for joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (LAUGHING)
dialogues.text: Not bad. (beat) For an old man. Frank's face almost cracks a smile. Almost. Frank offers a shaky handshake. Josh is about to grasp his hand when.. BADOOSH! The river SMASHES it's way through the dam, scattering their efforts downstream. Josh gazes in horror his world collapses.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No. Nononononononono! Josh sags to the floor and starts to SOB. He's finally reached his breaking point. Frank gazes at the cave walls resigned look on his face. Suddenly he bursts into HYSTER LAUGHTER. Josh explodes into a fierce rage.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Goddamn you! You made me believe! Josh starts hurling rock after rock at the uncaring cave walls. Frank can’t stop laughing. Josh starts throwing st at him instead. It only makes Frank laugh more. 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You...made...me...believe! Josh collapses onto the floor, sobbing uncontrollably. Fr eventually calms down. He approaches his son, wiping the tears from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: C'mon, get up.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why did I ever listen to you? Why? We're never getting out of here. Why can't you just admit that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We are getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No we're not! And that's okay! We fucking tried! We gave it our best shot!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Quit whining. Engage rational thought.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (FINALLY LOSING IT)
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Josh hurls another rock at Frank. This time he really mea business. Frank ducks as the rock SMASHES against the wal

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fuck you, fuck Carl and FUCK THIS

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMN CAVE
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: FUCK IT
dialogues.text: Josh rolls onto his back and lies there GASPING for breat Frank watches him dispassionately.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Finished?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Just let me die. That's all I want. Just let me die.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We don’t have time. 98 Frank disappears into the darkness, leaving Josh in the After a few moments, Josh starts CRYING. Great wracking S shudder through his body, leaving him a quivering mess, devoid of all humanity. Josh closes his eyes. cur TO: Josh open his eyes. They are caked in mud, tears and swea He sits up and gazes around him, unsure of his surroundin His vision blurs as a DIM LIGHT falls across his face. He watches the light approach. Holds out his hand in fear.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (TERRIFIED)
dialogues.text: L-Luko?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You ain't dead yet. It's Frank. Carrying a rock toward the water. SPLOSH! Fra heaves the rock into the sump and turns back toward Chimn Josh can see a fresh pile of rocks in the bottom of the s Frank has been busy rebuilding the dam. Josh staggers to his feet. His vision WHIRLS as he stagge after his father. He’s in a state of nervous exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: A HALLUCINOGENIC NIGHTMARE SEQUENCE as Josh helps Frank r build the dam. The COLERIDGE POEM repeats itself over and over, laying siege to Josh’s mind.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: In Xanadu...did Kubla Khan...a stately pleasure dome decree...where Alph...the sacred river ran...down to a sunless sea... The tunnel WHIRLS in and out of focus as he carries each down to the sump. POV Josh: the rock TRANSFORMS into a SCHOOL BOOK: “DAD‘S DIVE” by Josh Mcguire aged seven. A hand-drawn picture of diver, with Frank's NOTES scribbled in the margin. The COLERIDGE POEM becomes an annoying nursery rhyme, building in intensity over the following... Frank gazes up at Josh. Josh lifts the rock and SMASHES i into Frank's face. SPLOSH! The water shatters as Frank’s reflection disappears. 99 Luko’s reflection appears in its place. Then Victoria’s. are both SCREAMING as they drown. Josh reaches for them j ASwee Frank's reflection returns. He reaches toward Josh. FLASHBACK to 25 YEAR-OLD FRANK, dressed in shorts and a t-shirt, picking up 5 YEAR-OLD JOSH and playing “AIR-GUIT with him while an AC-DC TUNE blasts in the background. Frank spins Josh around and around in the brilliant sunsh They are in their back garden. Josh is LAUGHING as they s faster and faster. Josh’s MUM (20's) can be seen in the background, barbecuing. Her eyes are filled with love. Th concern. She’s pointing into Josh's PADDLING POOL. Luko and Victoria's lifeless bodies float below the surfa The young Frank suddenly starts SHAKING Josh like a rag d His face a mask of ANGER. Suddenly, his face transforms i the DEATH MASK worn by the Shaman. Josh starts to SCREAM as...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: REAL TIME: Frank shakes Josh awake.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ..ear what I said? We've got to get out of here. Now! Josh blinks and gazes around him. He’s standing in waist- water. The light from their FLASHLIGHTS has dimmed considerably: the batteries are almost dead. The dam is completed. The water level has already risen several feet and is working its way into the Chimney tunn Josh and Frank are unrecognizable: covered from head to f in mud, their fingers and faces cut and bloody. They collapse into each others arms, sharing a significan moment of accomplishment and achievement. Then they stagger back up toward Chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy George sits slumped against the far wall, his head resting against his chest. Josh races toward him and excitedly shakes him awake. 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George! We have to go now... Josh freezes. His hand comes away covered in blood. Georg eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (BARELY AUDIBLE)
dialogues.text: So c-c-cold...so v-very cold. Josh lifts Crazy George's arm. His DIVE KNIFE clatters to floor. Josh realizes in horror that he's used the blade t open his own wrists.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What have you done? We were getting out of here! What have you done! Frank races over. He coldly asses the situation.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE
dialogues.text: Reckon I’‘d s-save you the trouble, F-Frank. Frank nods and kneels next to his friend, holding his han

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY GEORGE, (SMILING)
dialogues.text: Don't look so...sad, Josh...You can'’t...get buried...deeper... The sentence hangs in the air. Crazy George is dead. A ROAR of water. Frank turns and flashes his light toward the tunnel. The river is already pouring into the chimney seconds they are waist deep. Josh and Frank stand in silence and watch Crazy George’s disappear beneath the water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: You have no control over this. Accept it. Frank and Josh stare long and hard at each other as the w continues to rise. Then Frank starts grabbing their remaining items of DIVE EQUIPMENT: MASKS, FINS. A wave of water hits them. They start spinning around the cavern, carried higher up the walls. The ceiling suddenly looms close: sure enough, a small ex tunnel can be seen above their heads. 101 Frank reaches up and makes a grab for the ceiling. He ca reach. He tries again. Fails.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s no good. I-I can’t reach it. Suddenly, Frank’s FLASHLIGHT flickers and dies.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Pass me your light! As Josh passes Frank the final FLASHLIGHT, Frank’s eyes narrow in concern. The dull beam reveals a black TIDAL MA around the walls of the chimney, left by the falling wate

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (SCARED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: The dam’s giving way.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: H-How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tidal mark. The water’s dropping. The same thought crosses their minds at the same time: th reach up toward the ceiling. It’s already further away. Suddenly, a grotesque GURGLING SOUND fills the air. In th center of the Chimney, a mass of floating debris suddenly starts to spin. Josh sees it too: a BLACK WHIRLPOOL is steadily forming around them as the water subsides.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Quickly! Josh swims over to Frank, who wedges himself into a crack the cave wall. Josh clambers up onto his father’s body an manages to grab an outcrop of rock on the ceiling. Clinging to the ceiling like Spiderman, Josh inches his w across the roof and up into the escape tunnel. He reaches down toward his father. Frank is already fighting to stay afloat as the whirlpool spins him around the cavern. Josh goes to grab his father. Misses. Grabs again. Just manages to clutch his hand. Neither of them speak. A simp look indicates the sudden shift of power. Josh hauls his father up out of the water. They gaze down the water in the chimney gets NOISILY flushed away. 102 Then their final FLASHLIGHT flickers out. Total darkness long unbearable silence.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (DEADPAN)
dialogues.text: Christ. It’s blacker than the inside of a dog. After a few seconds, Josh starts to CHUCKLE at Frank’s li Then he LAUGHS out loud. This causes Frank to burst out LAUGHING. Their hysterical gales of laughter fill the cav ECHOING off the walls.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: TIGHT on Josh’s face as he crawls along a narrow tunnel. only light now comes from his cheap INDIGLO DIVE WATCH. J pauses and points his watch back down the tunnel. Frank’s face eventually appears in the dim BLUE GLOW.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (PANTING)
dialogues.text: We...we can...rest here. There's not much battery left... Frank nods understanding. The light snaps out. Suddenly, hear Frank SNIFFING the air.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Fresh air! After a few seconds, Josh realizes he can dimly see his father.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is that...daylight? The sound of them both SCRABBLING forward in the dark. GLIMPSES of elbows, hands, then their faces appear, as th light in the tunnel grows steadily brighter. INT. BAT'S BELFRY. Josh reaches a small body tube in the cave wall. Dim ligh can be seen through the tunnel. Josh SHIVERS in delight a gust of wind HOWLS through the hole, ruffling his hair. J closes his eyes and INHALES deeply. He smiles at his Fath 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you, son... Josh crawls into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh pulls himself out of the body tube and gazes in disbelief. An enormous dome-shaped cavern, the size of an Olympic stadium. Sunlight pours in through a skylight in the ceil 200 feet above their heads. A tantalizing glimpse of blue as the Godly shafts of light pierce the gloom. Swallows a bats SWOOP around Josh, dancing in and out of the sunligh Josh flashes his light around the walls and ceiling: they sheer, smooth and impossible to climb.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (DEVASTATED)
dialogues.text: There’‘s no way out. Frank appears next to him. He notices Josh’s expression o bitter disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let’s check out the other side. They stumble forward into the light.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Josh and Frank scramble up the pile of debris that’s form directly below the skylight. As they clear the top they freeze: A M4-A2 SHERMAN TANK lays at the bottom of the slope, res on its side. It’s covered in 60 years of bat guano but otherwise it’s perfectly intact.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Now there’s something you don’t see every day. They scramble down to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There was a tank battalion stationed here during the war.(beat) We must be close to the ocean. 104  Josh glances up at the skylight far above them.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Christ. D’'you think anyone survived the fall? Frank HEAVES open the turret hatch. The SKELETAL REMAINS crew member falls out. The SKULL rolls toward Josh.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Guess not. Frank reaches inside the tank and pulls out a pack of S-RATIONS. He throws the pack to Josh with a big grin on face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hungry? cuT TO: A ROARING FIRE burns brightly in the center of the cavern illuminating the walls and casting a cheery glow. Frank douses another FALLEN BRANCH with gasoline from the Tank’ JERRY CAN and hurls it onto the flames. WHOOMPTH! Josh sits on top of the tank, wolfing down a bar of CHOCOLATE. He SIGHS at the indescribable pleasure of each mouthful as he basks in the heat from the fire.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (MOUTH FULL)
dialogues.text: This. Is. Fucking. Amazing. Josh glances up at the skylight. Billowing smoke rises up into the blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You think someone will see us?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hope can be a dangerous thing. We find our own way out. Josh gazes at the cave walls.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It's almost like it’s teasing us.

dialogues.speaker: PRANK
dialogues.text: Caves do that. 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? This one’s really starting to take the piss.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally. We’re here, now. And that’s all that matters. Until we accept that, we're never getting out of here. INT. BAT‘’S BELFRY - NIGHT Darkness. A dim BLUE LIGHT bathes Josh’s face. He snaps a and gazes around him, a confused look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: D-Dad?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What? Josh spots the STARS and MOON shining down through the skylight.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just checking. Josh gazes up at the stars. After a while he closes his e INT. SHINGLE SLOPE. BAT’S BELFRY - DAY Josh’s improvised TORCH splits the darkness. Narrow strip uniform, soaked in gasoline and wrapped around a RIFLE BU Josh is searching the shadows at the far side of the cave Frank’s torch can be seen in the distance. Early morning sunlight pours down through the skylight. Josh arrives at bottom of a steep shingle slope and scrambles up to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the slope, Josh finds a small tunnel in the cavern wall. It leads steadily downwards.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Dad! Over here! 106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel soon narrows. Sweat beads Josh’s brow as he squeezes his way down the tight body tube. The torch SING his hair and almost burns his face. Josh turns back toward his father. Frank is crawling thro the tunnel a few feet behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Listen! INT. CONNECTING SUMP. The sound of RUNNING WATER. Josh's head pops out of a sma hole in the ceiling of a medium-sized cavern. He throws h torch to the floor before gracefully easing himself down. Josh stands on the shoreline of a small lake. The river GUSHES out of the deep pool and disappears down a half- flooded tunnel. Josh eagerly starts exploring the room wh Frank struggles to get down from the hole. CRUMP! Frank enters the room far less gracefully than Jos Josh’s torch reflects off an object laying on the muddy shore: Carl's REBREATHER. Josh bends down to inspect it. GAUGES read “EMPTY”.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Carl's. Frank nods grimly. Shining their torches ahead of them, t cautiously enter the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Frank wade through the waist deep water, followi the sluggish river. Their torches reflect against the obsidian black walls. Josh wrinkles his nose in disgust. Floating in the water around them are dozens of DROWNED RATS. Josh pushes them aside and continues onward. The tunnel becomes filled with debris that has been washe down by the river: TREE BRANCHES, VEGETATION and the rott carcasses of several DEAD ANIMALS. Josh starts recognizin REBREATHER PARTS and DIVE EQUIPMENT, smashed and broken a the rocks lining the tunnel. 107  INT. DANTE’S NIGHTMARE Rounding a corner, the tunnel ends abruptly in a small ro filled with half-submerged rocks. The rocks act as a drai collecting any debris that’s been flushed into the cave. covers his nose and fights the urge to retch: the stinkin effluent has formed a festering lake. A MOAN in the darkn causes them to spin around. Cari sits SHIVERING in the darkness. He is almost unrecognizable: his face is covered in blood, mud and bruises. Madness rages in his eyes as he raises his hands protect himself from the harsh glare of their torches. Half-eaten RAT CARCASSES litter the shoreline around him. pile of dead FLASHLIGHTS lay discarded at his side. Carl staggers toward them, as if in a drunken stupor.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Y-You came for me. I-I knew you would... Carl lifts his hand toward the torch and caresses the fla

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (HYPNOTISED)
dialogues.text: So..-beautiful. Beyond price. I’d have given...anything. Everything. Just to see again. Josh pulls the flame away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: H-How long have I been in the dark? A week? A month? Frank and Josh exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You left us three days ago. Carl's face registers confusion. Then fear. He slumps to floor and starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You...have to help me. We have to...-help each other...help each other get out of here... Carl grabs Josh’s leg. Frank observes, stony-faced. 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only went to...scout ahead, Josh. I was...going to come back for you. But the current was...too strong. Josh kicks Carl away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You...-you have to believe me. Ask the others...if you don’t believe me...ask the others...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What others?

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (MANIC WHISPER)
dialogues.text: Them! Carl backs up against the cave wall, SHIVERING in fear. H casts a terrified glance toward the far side of the caver

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (TERRIFIED)
dialogues.text: They're here...All of them... Following Carl’s gaze, Josh and Frank shine their torches into the dark reaches of the chamber. It’s a scene from Dante’s own nightmare. Scattered among the debris are the hideously mangled rema of Judes, Luko, Crazy George and Victoria. The river has pummeled them into a twisted mass of skin a bone. Their lifeless eyes stare accusingly at them. Carl in the mud, ranting at the darkness

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (MUTTERING INCOHERENTLY)
dialogues.text: Now...we’re all here, I should call....the office... Frank ignores Carl. He wades toward Judes and starts tear her REBREATHER apart, so he can salvage both her CYLINDER

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Tell...Tell them we're delayed. You brought the phone with you? I have a meeting in just over an hour. We should arrange a press conference? Send photos...
