Frank coldly sifts through Judes DIVE RIG. He finds four CYLUME CHEMICAL LIGHT STICKS, tucked behind her WRIST SLA 109  He coldly reads the words he had written onto her slate: “TRUST ME!”. Frank throws the LIGHT STICKS over to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: C'mon. We're getting out of here. Carl crawls over to Josh and grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Take...take me with you. Please. Josh pulls his hand away..

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You are not to leave me here! I demand you take me with you! Josh and Frank cast a final glance down at Carl. They loo each other. Then turn and walk down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Josh! Josh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Josh are kneeling by the shoreline, fitting Jud cylinders into the REBREATHER.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I reckon we're only a couple of miles from the ocean... Frank nods toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We can buddy breathe through the sump. Follow the river. That will lead us out... Suddenly, a strange look crosses Frank’s face. He glances down in confusion and fear.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh...fuck... Josh reels back in horror. The tip of a DIVE KNIFE is sticking out of Frank's ribcage. Frank slumps to the floo Carl kneels behind Frank holding the bloodied knife. He l it toward Josh’s throat. 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me those fucking lights... Carl grabs the CYLUME LIGHT STICKS off Josh.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We...we can still get out of here...alive, Josh. You and me. Now we have these...I want you to fit....fit the oxygen tank... Josh stares down at his father’s body in shock. Carl push the knife hard against Josh’s throat. A sliver of BLOOD appears.

dialogues.speaker: DO IT
dialogues.text: Josh nods obediently. He reaches down and grabs the OXYGE CYLINDER. Lifts it into the REBREATHER.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (A GLANCE AT FRANK)
dialogues.text: That...son of a bitch...had it coming, Josh. He’d have...killed us all. Even you. You realize that...don’t you? I was acting in...self defense... Josh slowly nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Life’s...not a dress rehearsal, Josh. Sometimes...you...you have to... Suddenly, Frank MOANS. Carl’s eyes narrow in concern. He lifts the BURNING TORCH to take a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (COLD)
dialogues.text: Seize the day? Josh cracks open the OXYGEN CYLINDER VALVE. WHOOOMPH! A SHEET OF FLAME engulfs Carl. Carl is on fire. reels backwards SCREAMING in pain. Carl flails around the cavern floor in agony, his skin blistering. FSHHHHHH! A cloud of steam as Carl rolls into the sump to douse the flames. Carl surfaces, gazing around in fear an confusion just as... 111  BADOOSH! Josh leaps onto him in a primal, brutal fury. VARIOUS QUICK CUTS as they roll through the muddy water, reduced to animals in pure, savage survival mode. Biting. Clawing. Gouging. It's ugly. Visceral. Almost unbearable to watch. Carl sees the DIVE KNIFE laying in the mud where he dropp it. He crawls toward it. Josh drags him deeper back into sump. Carl SCREAMS in fear, clawing the mud. He KICKS Josh in t head. Josh releases him. Carl grabs Josh by the throat and forces his head under t water. SMACK! Josh’s knee thuds up into Carl’s ribcage, winding Carl slumps into the water, GASPING for breath. He turns around just as... CRACK! Josh smacks Carl in the face with the rock. Carl d to the floor. Josh SCREAMS in rage as he leaps onto Carl and starts pounding his head with the rock.

dialogues.speaker: THIS
dialogues.text: Suddenly, blood spatters Josh’s face. Josh gazes down in horror and drops the rock. He collapses to the ground and crawls through the mud to check if Frank is still breathi Josh starts RESCUE BREATHING. Frank's gaping chest wound HISSES noisily with each breath. Frank eventually COUGHS blood and opens his eyes. Gritting his teeth in pain, he reaches toward Josh.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The-the rebreather? Josh glances toward the sump. The REBREATHER is smoulderi by the water’s edge: the oxygen cylinder still on fire. J shakes his head sadly. Frank MOANS in despair and pain. Josh uses the knife to c strip from his WETSUIT. He starts padding Frank's wound. Frank gazes toward Carl’s unconscious body. 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he...dead?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I-I don’t think so. Frank suddenly grips Josh’s hand and looks him dead in th eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Kill him. Do it. Quickly. Before he wakes up. Josh considers this. Then heaves Frank toward the sump.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Let’s just get out of here. Josh pulls the DILUENT CYLINDER from the smouldering rema of the REBREATHER and clips it onto his harness.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: T-There’s not enough gas for...both of us. Take it, Josh. Leave me and...ahhhhh! Frank cries out in pain and fear.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (FIGHTING BACK TEARS)
dialogues.text: I‘m-I'm not leaving you here, Dad. Frank gazes around at the cave walls. He's suddenly fight for breath.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Listen...listen to me...You have to...trust me on this. Trust the cave..follow the river. It’1l lead you out...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It’ll lead us out. Josh drags Frank out into the water. As he pulls Frank's into place, a GROAN from the shadows causes Josh to look Carl is crawling through the mud toward the dying torch. face is covered in blood and burns. He reaches for the fl Just as it flickers out.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No! Noooooooce! 113  Carl is plunged into eternal darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie YELLOW GLOW fills the underwater sump as Josh CR open a LIGHT STICK. Frank and Josh bounce their way down the underwater cliff wall, into the depths of the sump. As they hit the sandy bottom, they see a small tunnel disappearing into the dar PFFT! Josh cracks open the DILUENT CYLINDER and snatches breath directly from the valve. Bubbles EXPLODE and POP around him. He offers the cylinder to Frank, cracking the valve open so he can take a breath. Then Josh grabs Frank harness and pulls him into the tunnel. Josh swims directly above Frank, orchestrating the task- loading job of BUDDY-BREATHING from the DILUENT CYLINDER, while pulling them both along the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Open. Breathe. Close. Pull. Open. Breathe. Close. Pull. Open. Breathe... After a while, the routine becomes fluid, like a beautifu choreographed ballet. Two people, working as one. VARIOUS SHOTS: The tunnel soon narrows into a tight restriction. Josh swims through, then reaches back and pu Frank after him. A lazy current carries them down a widening passageway. They drift through a huge chamber: spectacular speleothem connecting the ceiling to the floor. Frank's RATTLED BREATHING is growing steadily weaker as t continue. Josh and Frank ascend up an underwater cliff wall. They surface inside a tiny air bell: only six inches of airspace. Josh tilts his head back and gulps down several DEEP BREATHS.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (BREATHLESS)
dialogues.text: You...You got water in your mask..Here...let me... Josh removes Frank’s mask. Frank lolls, unconscious. 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Dad! Josh has to SHAKE his father back to consciousness. Frank blinks, spits blood and gazes around weakly.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You gotta stay with me!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (WEAK)
dialogues.text: N-no more. Please. Leave me here...It...hurts so bad... Josh drags his father’s mask back in place.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Just hang on. It can’t be much further now... Josh CRACKS open another LIGHT STICK with his teeth. They descend. They enter another beautifully decorated room, breaking through the shimmering HALOCLINE, from fresh water to sal water. Josh glances up: their exhalation bubbles break the glass surface of an air-filled chamber. Josh kicks weakly towar the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh drags Frank high up the shoreline and collapses into thick black clay covering the floor. Josh gazes around: another vast and featureless air-filled cavern: his LIGHT STICK barely pierces the dark.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hello! Josh sags wearily as his voice echoes into the far distan The cavern is huge. No obvious way forward. Frank suddenl COUGHS up more blood. He’s struggling for breath and SHIVERING in pain. Josh gazes down at him numbly. Josh shuffles over and opens Frank’s WETSUIT ZIP to inspe his chest wound. His eyes widen in fear as he removes the blood-soaked dressing. Frank’s lost a lot of blood: a red river trickles down the shoreline. Frank MOANS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: J-Josh. L-L-Leave me! 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! Easy now. (obviously lying) Can you feel it? There’s a breeze coming from somewhere. We must be close. Josh staggers to his feet. He CRACKS the third CYLUME STI and hands Frank the old one.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I'm going to scout ahead. (smiling grimly) Don’t worry. I won’t get lost. Josh wades his way along the shoreline, his feet SUCKING OOZING into the knee-deep clay. After a hundred yards, something makes him stop and look back. Josh suddenly loo very frightened. He retraces his footsteps to find... Frank has gone. Josh follows the trail of blood down to t waters edge.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Dad! Frank is laying with his face in the mud, desperately try to suck water into his lungs in an attempt to kill himsel Josh races over and pulls Frank's face clear of the water Frank RAGES in anger and frustration as Josh drags him ba up the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Unnng! Goddamn it! Kill me! Do this for me. Josh. Kill me. Please... You have to...have to... Frank suddenly reaches up and touches Josh's face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (INTENSE)
dialogues.text: .+-Forgive me...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What for? Frank lapses into unconsciousness. His head lolls against Josh’s knee, only inches from the water. Josh stares down his father, shaking in fright. Suddenly, Josh grabs Frank’s head and holds it above the water.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Do it! Do it! Do it!... 116  Josh stares at his hand, transfixed as it inches Frank's mouth down into the water. The water is about to cover Frank’s nose when... Josh pulls Frank's head back up into his lap. He throws b his head and WEEPS openly, cradling his father’s head in arms. He can’t bring himself do it.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: LONG CONTINUOUS SHOT as we follow a set of muddy footprin along the shoreline of the river. Next to the footprints be seen the deep imprint of an object being dragged. The footprints go on for what seems like miles. We hear a MAN echoing across the distant walls. Spoken lyrics from an o song.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “It ain't easy...Livin’ free... Season ticket on a one-way ride....Askin’ Nothing...leave me be...Takin’ everything in my stride...”...Shit...How...How’s... the next bit go? We follow the footprints over a huge DEBRIS SLOPE. Then d the other side, back into the river.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S)
dialogues.text: “Don’t need reason...Don’t need rhyme...Ain’t nothing that I'd rather do...” Goddamn it!. Help me out...This was your...stupid song... Finally, the dim yellow glow of Josh's LIGHT STICK can be seen in the distance. Josh staggers along the knee-deep river, his father hoisted across his back in a fireman’s carry. The DILUENT CYLINDER drags in the water behind the It’s backbreaking work. Josh is mumbling to himself, close to a complete emotiona and physical breakdown. The sound of a WATERFALL can be h directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Going down...Party time...My friends are going to be there too..I’m on a...” Josh emerges into... 117  INT. CRYSTAL PALACE. A cavern of magnificent wonder and beauty. The chamber is finely decorated with millions of delicate CALCITE STRAWS hanging from the ceiling. Josh's LIGHT STICK reflects the exquisite crystal formations that cover every inch of the walls. A fine mist fills the air. The river disappears into a vast circular pit in the floo the cave. Around the pit, several other rivers cascade ou the cavern walls to form one great one big circular water plunging into infinity.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (HUSHED WHISPER)
dialogues.text: “,..Highway to hell”. Josh gently lowers his father to the edge of a shallow po Then stumbles to the edge of the precipice and gazes down throws his fading CYLUME STICK over the edge and watches disappear into the darkness. A bottomless pit. No way down. No tunnel leading on. Josh CRACKS open the final LIGHT STICK and falls to his knees. Josh smiles as he gazes around the cavern, finally accepting his reality. His face reveals a peaceful revere He's breathing the cave in. Feeling it. Finally getting i

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Josh sits in a shallow pool overlooking the falls. Frank cradled in Josh’s arms, unconscious. Josh gazes around at cavern. Then leans over and kisses his father. Frank's eyes flicker open. He gazes up at Josh, a serene on his face. Frank closes his eyes. Then nods, once. Josh gently lowers his father’s head beneath the surface the water. There’s no panic. No drama. Josh watches his father die a it's the most natural thing in the world. After a few sec it's over.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (WHISPER)
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad. Josh closes his eyes. Darkness engulfs us.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 118 Josh stands confidently at the edge of the cliff clutchi the DILUENT CYLINDER and the LIGHT STICK. He turns and ta a final look at his father’s body, floating lifeless in t pool. Josh steels himself, turns and steps out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV Josh: staring at the yellow glow from the LIGHT STICK he falls through the darkness. The occasional glimpse of CLIFF WALL and the WATERFALL flashing by. The sinister HO of wind as the air rushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (INNER MONOLOGUE)
dialogues.text: Here. Now. This is who I am. Who you made me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BADOOSH! Josh plunges into a deep pool of water at the ba of the falls. He breaks the surface, COUGHING and SPLUTTE before being whisked away by a fast flowing river. Boulders loom in the dark. Josh steers himself around the best he can. A cliff wall suddenly materializes. The rive being sucked underground at a ferocious rate. Josh takes final deep BREATH just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is sucked down into the inky blackness. He allows th river to sweep him along. CRUNCH! He is slammed against t side of the tunnel. DING! His DILUENT CYLINDER scrapes al the ceiling. CRACK! His facemask shatters. Josh rips it f his face. Josh tumbles head over heels, bouncing off the walls on a roller-coaster ride into hell itself. Josh grabs a desper BREATH from the DILUENT CYLINDER and waves his LIGHT STIC around. POV Josh: in the dim beam, he can see the hazy outline of MARINE CORAL covering the tunnel, suggesting h may be close to the ocean wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The current suddenly subsides and Josh finds himself drif down a wide tunnel, filled with beautiful CORAL SPONGES. allows himself to be carried by the current. He has a cal look upon his face. No fear at all. 119 PFFFT! Every few seconds, he reaches down and takes anot BREATH from the DILUENT CYLINDER. Bubbles dance and POP against the ceiling of the tunnel. PFFFT..FFF..F..T...... Suddenly, the DILUENT CYLINDER is empty. Josh smiles, shr and lets it fall. Inverting himself so he’s staring up at the ceiling, Josh see BUBBLES from his previous exhalations forming a tiny POCKET in the ceiling of the cave. He sees his hazy reflection in the bubble. Josh takes a SIP of air from th bubble and watches it trickle further down the tunnel, li mercury. Josh follows the bubble, gazing in wonder as it gets smal and smaller with each breath he takes. His reflection steadily reduces until...SHLOOP! A final breath...and the pocket has gone. Josh turns away from the ceiling. A school of YELLOW-TAIL JACKS suddenly darts into his light. The fish CIRCLE him, becoming temporary escorts as they lead him further down tunnel. POV JOSH: a DREAM-LIKE AURA clouds his vision, slowing hi every movement. He’s suffering from hypoxia: severe lack oxygen. His HEARTBEAT can be heard hammering in his chest Josh’s vision finally starts to narrow. Shapes WARP and S around him. The sound of his HEARTBEAT grows steadily lou until... BLOOMPTH! Josh exhales his final breath. Josh relaxes. He releases the LIGHT STICK and watches it float away into the darkness. As he sinks to the floor of cave, he is convinced he can see his father gazing at him from the shadows. Josh reaches toward him. Then blackness engulfs him. INT. SEA CAVE — DAY Darkness. The distant echo of waves SHUSHING against a sh Another sound, less defined. The sound of CHILDREN’S LAUGHTER. Suddenly, a tiny shaft of brilliant white light pierces t gloom. The dime-sized beam tracks slowly across a rock an illuminates Josh’s hand. The light moves slowly up his ar and across his chest until it finally caresses his face. Josh's eyes flicker open. 120 Staring down at him is the smiling face of six-year old BOY wearing a SNORKEL MASK. The boy LAUGHS and waves a YE TAILED SNAPPER in Josh’s face.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL BOY, (PIDGIN ENGLISH)
dialogues.text: Yes Mista. You wantem pem sum blue fish? Hem ee good tu-mahs! Josh slowly sits up. He’s laying on the shoreline of a se cave: a dome-shaped room connected directly to the ocean a gaping underwater entrance. Blue shafts of light from t ocean flicker across the walls. Josh gazes up: a skylight in the ceiling casts a brillian beam of sunlight down into the cave. It’s stunningly beautiful. Josh smiles. The local boy takes Josh by the hand and leads him back i the water. Other children can be seen in the ocean entran SPEAR FISHING with snorkeling gear. The boy continues to LAUGH and CHATTER as he pulls Josh across the surface toward the blue window. Josh ducks beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glassy ocean is rent asunder as Josh breaks the surfa A LOCAL FISHERMAN gazes down at him from his DUGOUT CANOE surprised expression on his face. Josh gulps down a deep BREATH of air. He throws back his and floats, gazing up at the sun.
